review: SUMMARY: good reasonably priced  food. Decent service. Long wait time. Would come back and recommend to others.  Service: Came in and waited to be seated for about 15-20 mins despite there only being 1 group of 9 people, ahead of me.  When I was seated it took a while for them to actually take my order. The employees were very nice though when they were  paying attention. Everyone was always serving with a smile. The manager came by tables later on asking how everyone was doing. It was very welcoming and redeemed the customer service aspect for me.  Food: My boyfriend ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burger and I got the Fiery Ghost Tavern Double -- "The big ghost". This just meant that instead of a double patty burger, they were going to put one big patty instead. My burger was very tasty and the jalapenos didn't feel soggy. Nice to know it was fresh. I didnt try my boyfriend's burger because I was so focused on my own and all the flavors lol. The fries were also good. None were soggy or too greasy so we definitely got more.

I like Red Robins, but I HATE this particular Red Robins.  Usually Red Robins the staff is nice, friendly, smiley, and seems to hustle and be quick with their table service.  Unfortunately, I dont experience even one of these things both times I've visited, and this was both before and after their re-model.  I usually order take out from this location and every time am disappointed.  Yesterday I come to pick up my order and an Uber is sitting in the space for 2go orders so I had to snag the only space left available - a handicap space. I park here and the uber guy starts trying to hit on me which makes me uncomfortable, if y'all patrolled your parking area maybe your customers wouldnt be getting harassed by pervs...  Anyways, I walk in behind a Kitchen Staff who holds the doors open for customers who are exiting, but then looks at me and lets the door go. I'm a half second behind this fat mofo and he does it again in their second entry way of the foyer. Ok... things are off to a fantastic start right?  Then I go up to the hostess and ask about 2go orders, and she points me at the red counter just to my right. I stand there, and shes still standing there at her podium, and does not assist me. In fact, no one assisted me for about 5 whole minutes. Waitresses and bussers walking by, the hostess still looking bored at her podium, and what appears to be a Manager overseeing it all, not jumping in to help. Awesome manager skillz. Finally some guy comes up, hes friendly and he gets my order info but then a call comes in. He ends up taking this phone call for about 4+ minutes, while NO ONE comes in to go get the food. Again, manager is just standing there at the front of the house, girl at the podium still standing there, but nope, everyone's too busy to fetch the food. Finally the call ends and he moseys to the back and comes back with my order.  I walk out back to my car where the uber driver is still there waiting for me to return. He continues to harass me and yell thru his window.  GREAT EXPERIENCE!! Woo hoo! I will not be doing a 2go order anytime in the future, not with this Red Robin location.

I came into this Red Robin when I first moved into the Reserve apartments and hadn't unpacked the kitchen yet. The service was okay, however, the food was not. I ordered a burger (they're supposed to be known for the burgers apparently) and the size of the patty I got was definitely NOT 1/3 lbs. I ordered it medium rare with what I verbalized was a "pink, warm center" and the burger came out flattened and well done. I tried to eat it because I don't like returning food, but here's the worst part.  The bartender saw the burger and commented, "Oooooh, that looks a little more well than you wanted it..." and I confirmed that yes, it was more well done than I had asked for. She just said, "Sorry about that..." and walked away. Didn't ask me if I wanted another one, and didn't remove it from my bill. Needless to say that's the last time I have been in.  The visit was on 5/14/2017 and I just found the receipt in my drawer reminding me to leave this review.  There are much better options within a single mile radius, I wouldn't go here.
Ordered online and said no tomatoes in my burger. Guess what I bit into when I was eating. A tomato!! Yuck. And they over peppered my egg....I had to wipe most of it off.

To start our waitress spilled a glass of water all over one of us, then ran from our table crying. It took 10 minuets for someone to bring towels to clean it up. No offer of a free drink and she barely got an apology. But clearly the waitress was upset over it. The fries were cold and appetizers came with the meals. No manager seemed to be on site or even care what was taking place in the dinning area. If you like Red Robin I would skip this location.

It pains me to write this review, because I like Red Robin for their service and friendliness. However, for the past two times we called in an order for pick up, the fries were old and the one of our orders was completely wrong! Horrible, because one of our friends is allergic to cheese and they gave us a burger with cheese on it. The fries were so old they tasted horrible. It certainly was not worth our gas to drive back down to get a refund at RR. Suffice it to say, any order pick ups should be double checked and the customer should be given the same quality of food as if they were to dine in! There's a saying, "They always screw you in the drive through".

Sub par. Too many options to choose from. For a 10 dollar burger you want big and succulent. What I received was something of what could have been made at home. Decent service nothing spectacular about it.

We come here because it has vegetarian options for hubby and sometimes, while we love 5 Guys...we really just want a sit down restaurant.  The Landing has a few restaurants and we've been to most of them.  The standout stuff here (for me) are not the burgers, but I've had some servers here that are so slow it's taken 30 minutes for food to come out...and I've also had my order wrong. If I were less lazy and tired, I'd haul my butt down the other Red Robin out in Tukwila, but sometimes I really want something close to home that isn't fast food. I love Red Robin's shakes and malts. No whip, no cherry...chocolate or vanilla shake or chocolate or vanilla malts with EXTRAAAAAAAA MAAAALLLT!!!! There's a reason why we're not here every week day or week...and it's the shakes/malts. The long and short of it is I've found this RR, in general, to be one of the worst out of all the RRs I've been to (the first is the one at Rivermark in San Jose, CA, with a manager who called me and seemed so disinterested in what I had to say about poor service I received)...and as a total heifer who has eaten at all the RRs in CA, WA and OR (ok, totally ashamed to admit that, but I need to establish my credibility when I make statements like the one in the sentence before!), I don't like saying that because I'm a total RR fan since the early 90s. Great, now I'm showing my friggin age. Anyway, we come here because it's one of the few sit down restaurants that's open late near us. It's not like we come here 2-3 times a week, but we do come here once a month to throw in a little variety in our dining out options.

Another Landing staple, freshly renewed after coming down with a bad case of fire. We never aim to go here but sometimes get pulled in by the smell, which I do not think is coincidence. Its OK, but there are limited options at The Landing and sometimes you just need a burger that's not quite as greasy as 5 Guys. The long and short of it:  1. Sandwiches. I don't say burgers because I rarely get a burger here. My personal favorite is the Whisky River BBQ Chicken sandwich, it's a nice mix of flavors and a bit lighter than a burger. They offer it as a wrap as well but usually skimp on the chicken then. They offer a large array of rotating burgers that are decent, not great. It'll do for a mid-day burger craving when it comes to it. 2. Bottomless Sides. Again, I don't just say fries because the sides are variable. Yes you can do bottomless steak fries but you can also sub this out for bottomless salad, broccoli or cold slaw for no extra cost. The Broccoli lacks in taste so I'll usually spring for the salad. Then again you're here, might as well go all in on the fries. They'll give you ranch and campfire sauce (still not entirely sure what this is but its good) upon request to dip. 3. Booze. A large selection of beers and liquor is offered but I've only been here for work lunch so I've never taken advantage of this (that you know of). A nice option to have. 4. Staff. The staff here is awesome and attentive, especially for a place located so close to a large factory that fills up quickly. They've always been exceptional at keeping glasses full, fry baskets coming and people fed. 5. Price. It's pricey for Red Robin, but that's The Landing for ya. A burger and fries will run you over $10 alone. Tack on a drink or appetizer and you're looking at a bill that I wouldn't want to pay for OK food.  6. Payment. You can split bills by item and pay via table consoles which is neat and speeds things up a bit. Much appreciated for people who need to get back to work. I'm not crazy about Red Robin, but it is what it is and every once in awhile you just have to grab a burger and entirely too many fries. Just try to not get dragged in by the smell too much! Overall Grade: C

We are big Red Robin fans.  You know when I was once in the restaurant business years ago I thought of an invention to have a computer screen at the table where the customer can call the server, possibly even order drinks or food, and pay the bill.  Too bad I never had any money to launch my product.  Red Robin has executed this strategy and has even added trivia and games to it making it fun for everyone at the table. As far as the food goes, Red Robin has something for everyone with a specialization in Burgers.  They have TV's everywhere in the bar and no real bad item on the menu.  My kind of place and they do have Manny's on tap which I will maintain is worth a half star extra in my criteria.

So we were seated right away then ordered pretty fast took for ever to get our drinks then food came out not impressed I thought we ordered fries not chips so hard and cold same as our burgers buns were soggy from being under the lamp our waitress took for ever to come by out of drinks cold food terrible service just seems like big chains you don't get the best of anything and they want 15.00 per hr do a better job and earn it

Brooke was very nice and friendly. the reason I am giving a bad review is because our table was sat directly under a freezing cold fan. then  half of our food came out cold. most of us ordered the mac and cheese . it looked really good on the menu. it had breadcrumbs and all kinds of goodness on it. it comes out and they were very disappointing.  toast chunks on top, noodles with melted cheese on top. that's not mac and cheese! false advertisement. the TV had boring work our infomercials the whole time. not even sports.  thankfully brooke made up for the poor food.

Stopped for a late dinner.  Was told there was a 15 to 20 minute wait.  Hostess came out and tried to take us  to a large table. I asked if there was a booth available. Although I saw several empty ones we were told we would have to wait.  We ended up eating another 12 minutes. Finally we were taken to dining area by hostess who stopped us in front of a dirty table. The busser started to wipe the table and ended up throwing left over food onto me. Not even so much as an apology. I asked him please not to throw the food on me. He just looked at me but said nothing. We ordered our food. Wedge salad as appetizers and Royal Red Robin burger. Waited over 20 minutes for salad and it was only after the waitress walked by and had an ah ha moment....did she remember the salad. The burgers were not that great...the lettuce wilted. Asked for more fries and was given half cooked fries luke warm. Asked the waitress to bring other batch and it looked like they just added some more cooked fries on top of the undercooked ones. I asked to speak to the manager who finally came over.  I told her about our experience from the beginning. I told her I understood it was busy and a Saturday night but the service was terrible. I told her it looks like they just added a few cooked fries on top of the undercooked ones.  She said that the 1st basket had been tossed out but the kitchen staff just mixed the 1st batch of undercooked fries with the second batch under the heat lamps and then put them in a new basket for me.  If I sent them back in the 1st place why would I want undercooked fries again? My wife mentioned that the meal in general was not good and her burger tasted strange. I pointed out that the lettuce on the burgers was extremely wilted like it was bad. She blamed it on the heat lamps saying the lettuce wilts immediately under the high heat but it was more like the lettuce was old not heated. She told my wife that she would take the burger of her bill. (We asked for separate checks to take advantage of our separate rewards offers)   The manager said the waitress was in tears over the situation.....and that she is one of the more loved waitresses there. She again said it wasn't really the waitress' fault but the kitchen staff.  The waitress came back out with my fries but didn appear to have been crying. She left the bill however and my wife pointed out that the manager said she was going to deduct the burger as she didn't eat it because of it tasting badly. My wife handed her a 20 and I gave her my credit card...before I could mention my rewards (and she didn't ask if I was a member) she was off to the races.  I told her to hold up......I needed to give her my rewards number....she grabbed a pen and took down my phone number. She didn't come back but the manager did with the credit card slip and the change for my wife.  She said again she apologized and said that the waitress was in tears (again) but hoped that we would give them another chance.  I told the manager that this didn't appear to be an isolated occurrence as she had to apologize to the table next to us for having their order mixed up and delayed getting them the right one and that it looked liked she had to be apologizing to a few other tables as well. She said they were short handed amd a bit off their game tonight.  I said that judging by the comments on yelp that this has been going on for some time.  She said she had just recently came to this location but did read some of the less than favorable reviews.   Evidently nothing has been done to correct the issues.  She again apologized and told us to have a good night. My wife looked at her bill $3.27 for the wedge salad amd counted the change.  15.75.  She at first thought she had been shorted 2 cents.  I said no she gave 75 cents back and covered the 2 pennies but actually short changed a dollar on the change back. On our way out I asked the hostess to call the manager again.  The manager came up and I handed her the bill.  I said the bill was 3.27 and this is the change you gave back. She counted it and says oh you are short five dollars.  I said no...you gave back 15.75 it should have been 16 not 15 dollars back plus the change. "Oh.....well it's just a dollar."  Then she blamed the waitress saying that she was so flustered that she didn't make the correct change...even though it's was the manager that brought the change and credit slip to be signed. I hope that the company didn't bring this manager in to fix this location because she is way off the mark.  She didn't say she would talk to the busser about his throwing food off the table to me, kept coming up with excuses for the waitress, blamed the kitchen staff for the problems with the fries (eventhough the waitress shoikd a have double check make sure they were all cooked enough) and then throws the waitress under the bus for the incorrect change.   She did go back to get "just a dollar" but we left.

This restaurant has some great family friendly/kid friendly features. One of which is a fun chalk board in the waiting area. Another perk is a coloring and activity sheet on the back side of the kids menu. I took notice of the new tablets they have at each table. You can order food, pay your tab, or order games for the kids to play at about 1.99 per game.  The kids menu has many choices to choose from and decently priced choices. The drinks are free to refill, so feel free to order as many chocolate milks as your child can handle. My children ordered the pepperoni pizza and mandarin oranges. They didnt seem to like the microwave pizza but could tolerate the fries. My husband and I had onion rings, a chicken ceaser wrap, and chicken club sandwich. Each dish was okay. I thought the wrap was a bit stale and not so fresh. Tbe onion rings were probably the best thing we ate there tonight. But hey its Red Robin, we enjoyed the family time at the end of the night.  I cannot forget  to rate the service. We had a very polite waitress. It was packed so service was slow, understandably.

A Hostess/Server lady (her name's Stacey or something like that) didn't wash her hands coming out of a bathroom stall. Walked out of the bathroom stall and went straight to work. Eeeeek! Gross!!! Asked for medium rare burger with pink inside and got very cooked well done burger. Why bother asking how I like my meat cooked if you're not going to bother considering it?  Don't think I'll come back anytime soon.

We came in on 4/21/17 around 10pm to order something to go. The lady that rang me up was not exactly friendly which I can understand at the end of a long shift but this was a bit more than that. I tried really hard to be extra nice to her but it didn't seem to help. To be clear, the girl that was working the bar and take out was working her ass off and was pleasant. The girl that rang me up to help her was not I ordered a bonsai salad that had really good chicken on it but the dressing was so mustardy that I could only have a few bites before I gave up. I should have tasted the dressing before I poured it on. The menu does not specify that the salad has a honey mustard type dressing instead of an Asian dressing which would make more sense. Again, I should have asked. They also didn't give me the garlic toast that was supposed to come with it.  My boyfriend got chicken tenders with a total of six fries with them, all of which were ice cold. The amount you pay for the amount of food you get with this is not good.  My friend got the pub mac n cheese which had no flavor to it at all and the serving size was like a side instead of a full order.  Again, for how much you pay the amount of food you receive will leave you with an, "I obviously just wasted my money" feeling. And I'm still hungry!

The Renton Landing Red Robin is the worst. We went there once with a group of 4 and they got 3 of the 4 orders incorrect along with other bad things that happened during our meal. We went there again last night with a group of 7 and it was the same experience. The floor in the place was so greasy that it was like walking on ice getting to our table. It took 15-20 minutes for a server to even come to the table.   The first order of food they brought out was not even our order and the place wasn't busy. When they did bring the correct items, 2 of the orders were incorrect.  The appetizer that was ordered was the LAST item brought to the table.   The queso dip had a LARGE chunk of hamburger patty in it.   Most everything about this experience was bad and that was twice in a row.   We will never eat at this Red Robin again.

We frequent Red Robin because the four kids can be loud and they usually eat their entire meal here. The bottomless basket of fries helps too. The quality of food and menu has definitely changed with some things getting worse - like the garlic fries, and some things improving like the variety of burgers offered. I was disappointed that the milkshakes don't come with the leftovers in the metal cups anymore and they give you the exact amount. Our service has always been attentive and quick. The wait can be long during peak times but the nice thing is they'll take your cell number and you can shop around the Landing until your table is ready. The table tablet to pay with is hit or miss and sometimes works for us to order drinks and appetizers as well as pay and sometimes does not, even with the server trying to assist us with it.

If I could, I would give this place a 0. My sister and I were turned away from the bar because the restaurant did not accept our Guam (US Territory) Driver's License.  First off, We were first told to go to the bar because it was busy on the family side (we are over 21 years old). Then when the server came over to check our IDs, he said they don't accept them. He asked the bartender, who also said it wasn't acceptable. Such a shame. Now I feel I need to bring my US passport everywhere I go because of this incident.

First off, I must say I was really sad when the chain took out the cheeseburger sliders from their appetizer menu. That was my go-to back then and didn't like the fact that I had to choose something else to order from that point on. Otherwise, this is the spot to go to if you want gourmet burgers for a decent price, and it has been a great addition to the Landing. I always say I'll order something new every time but I always get the Prime Chophouse because nothing else on the menu really appeals to me. I feel like I can never finish it in one sitting! This burger is unique because it has onion straws, horseradish, and even topped with a free onion ring! Their fries are pretty good also, and they're bottomless so dig in! Sadly, they don't give them to you in a basket anymore, they're trying to be fancy and give the food on a small tray and doesn't really give you a lot of fries to begin with so you might need to ask for more right when you get your food if you know you'll eat a lot of them. I've always been too full for dessert until last night, I was craving more dessert than a burger. We ordered a chocolate brownie cake topped with vanilla ice cream and a berry drizzle. I wish it was a bit more moist but still yummy nonetheless! I gotta give a shoutout to our server Brooke last night thought. She was super sweet, kept checking up on us, and reminding us that our drinks/dessert will be on their way soon. If you ever eat at the Landing location, try to make this girl your server! I don't eat at Red Robins that often anymore, I had my rewards card for years but I feel like I only eat here on my birthday or some random occasion. But I'll definitely come back!
The hostess wasn't good but once we sat down, Brooke, our waitress was fantastic!  Couldn't be happier with the service.  Thank you Brooke!

Food was good. Waiter was good but the food runner was super rude. Didn't get his name though.  And when my friend was going to ask us if we order this. He said well it's on the ticket and tossed it on the table. He gave us attitude the whole time

As soon as we walked in we should have turned away. The host was casually chatting to a server and we had to wait for their work-unrelated conversation to end. Then she tried to direct us to the bar- I politely said no thanks and we wanted to sit in the main part of the restaurant. I received attitude. They are so lazy!! Now the food- ordered a whiskey river bbq burger which came out fairly quickly BUT speed does not equal quality at all! The bun was stale, the onion straws were a soggy oily mess. The fries were old! Seriously why pay high prices for crappy service, below mediocre food? Might as well go through a drive through and get your food even faster for 1/2 the price!

I have never met the MEANEST hostess. As I walked up she was arguing with the party before me rolling her eyes and everything. So being understanding, I gave her a smile and told her my party size she was speaking rudely in such an irritating tone. Definitely not a welcoming person at all. I came in on Sunday the 30th at 3 with no welcoming from STACI (on her name tag, darker skinned, with braids). If you can't handle a busy day, then find a new JOB. I seen another hostess upset with her as well as the party before me. Staci needs to be fired.

Yesterday I discovered the premium burger list, namely the Madlove burger.  The premium burgers are not to be confused with their gourmet burgers; they have a half pound of premium meat and a ciabatta bun and on the Madlove burger, the perfect blend of bacon, avocado, cheese and some kind of spicy relish.  It was the best burger I have ever had!  I turn 70 this year so I have had a few burgers.  The ciabatta bun is strong enough to hold it together, the meat was moist and juices dripped into my hand but not too much.  It is pricy but worth it for a most satisfying burger experience.

It's been a while since I've been to Red Robin. We came for dinner. The place was packed and we did have to wait a while. When we were finally seated, our server was awesome. She continually checked on us, even though she was busy serving other tables. As usual, the food was great.
Awesome restruant,  visited this location once again.  Very impressed with there service and attention to detail.No complaining from me
Was going to take a pic but I ate it before I could. Best burger I've had in some time and the service was incredibly quick. I wouldn't hesitate to eat here again.

Ive been there 2 times. The first time they screwed up my order so bad. Nothing was correct. Second time they not only screwed it up, they had the guy who i saw was cleaning the front kitchen floor stop doing that and bring us our food , spilling dressing all over our utensils and not bringing new ones to us, there was 12 years between visits lol you thonk they would have gotten it right in that amount of time lol. Yeah wont be back

Not sure about all the negative reviews,  but today they were on point. Our waitress Brooke was quick and thorough. She had a smile not only with us, but with all the other customers as well. The food was hot and tasty and you just can't beat the bottomless fries and campfire sauce.

I used to like going here with friends before hitting up a movie. Unfortunately the staff for some reason decides to not be overly friendly recently. I ordered an item off the menu, the waitress took the order, then came back and stated she wasn't allowed to deliver that item to the area I was sitting (at the bar). I was confused and embarrassed, but stated that is what I wanted. I asked if the manager could okay it, she scoffed and walked away in a rude huff. About 3 minutes later the item was delivered, with a mean look from the waitress and not saying anything else. To top it off my drink sat empty for a while (enough time for her to come by and refill my friend's drink) and she didn't seem to care. I only go here when there are time constraints and I never expect good food.

If you are looking for a good burger, Red Robin is a great choice. This location I am a fan of because it's close to the movie theater. So grabbing a burger and then catching a film is a great evening in my book.  Food here is like all other Red Robins out there, but I will tell you my likes/recommendations: Burgers =  - Guacamole Bacon Burger (On lettuce instead of a bun.)  *I dig a burger with Swiss cheese! - Grilled Turkey Burger  - Blue Ribbon Burger  Other sandwiches =  - BLTA Croissant *Who doesn't love avocado on their sandwich! YUMMY! Sweet side =  - Mountain High Mudd Pie (Definitely a dessert to share as it's huge!)
This is one of the worst place to dine in. I will never go back. Bad service nasty food , all the servers have bad attitude.

This is a chain restaurant, you are going to receive cookie cutter food with cookie cutter service since it's a cooperate and servers are probably being micro-managed so I don't look for personable service, I look for consistent food, and that's the way it goes. The reason why Red Robin gets my business is because for $10, I know whatever entree I get, it'll fill me up. The burgers itself are huge already, but when you add in bottomless fries to the meal(they cut you off at some point if you are being unreasonable greedy), it's a lot of food. I'm a huge fan of their fries, thick steak cut fries, it's probably my favorite. Their honey mustard and camp fire sauce is on point to dip with anything whether it be fries, chicken strips, or burgers. They have a house seasoning that you can also purchase to bring home. Their freckled lemonade is also great.  This is probably one of the first useful addition of the Renton Landing before it bloom to what it is right now, it's close by the Regal Cinemas so convenience if you were to make this a casual dinner & movie type of deal. During the summers and holidays, they extend their hours.  There's plenty of parking around as this is in the Landing, it might be a bit harder to find super close spots on the weekends, but you will find one. I've been a customer at Red Robin ever since high school homecoming days and the food has tasted the same since then. Tell me about your experience if you've been here or is going to after reading this review:)

Friday night-loooong week, hubs and I super tired, so we wanted to eat out, Plus I had a Free Birthday Burger coming.  NOT HAPPY AT ALL WITH OUR EXPERIENCE. My bad, I should have complained at the time, but was so tired and bleary eyed, things did not register with me til we got home. NO. 1)  Stupid Trivia game.. saw it, thought it might be fun, so played a little.  WE WERE BILLED $1.99 FOR THIS!  WHAT??? i did not see it posted anywhere that it had a cost...SCREW THAT!  Not worth $2 to play some dumb electronic trivia. 2). Waiter said my birthday burger had to come from the Gourmet burger page.  So hubs and I both looked ONLY at THAT PAGE.  I ordered a California... my hubs said the Blue Cheese, and POINTED TO THE ONE THAT WAS $10.95 ON THAT PAGE. The waiter then said "Oh, the Black and Blue?"?.  We don't know their menu, so my hubs said "yeah, sure".  SCREW THAT, the waiter "tricked" us into a $14 burger instead. 3) PAYING THE BILL;  You now pay on these electronic  terminals on the tables (which have the trivia games)...  It asked about tip and I slid the green arrow to 20%.  At home I REALIZED THEY CHARGED ME $9.70 ON A $36 BILL!   That is almost 30%.  WHAT!!! I HATE THE ELECTRONIC terminals....   Your receipt/bill comes out of that... I want a bill that lists what we ordered, what it costs and allows me to fill in any amount I freaking feel like for a tip. We won't be back!  Screw those new terminals, and their sneaky charges.  We specifically went there because our budget is really tight right now and I had the free burger... but it ended up costing a lot more than we planned!   Must say I do love their burgers and fries... but not all these other issues!

Good server, but unfortunately she was overloaded with too many tables to give good service.   The kitchen failed to meet the one specification of my burger.  Where's a manager when a server needs one?   Hmm, I guess this is an example of what happens when corporate cuts labor...the customers suffer. After my experience, the corporate office promptly followed up with me.  They were very empathetic and made things right.  Not many companies care these days, but Red Robin surely does.   One thing is for sure, I will be returning to Red Robin again.  Thanks corporate, you guys rock!

We came in and waited for a table. The server just sat us down and gave us nothing  for the longest. No water and no menu. Worst part about it was that she sat us right by the restroom. She didn't even ask if we were okay with it. We ended up leaving and walked right out. Terrible service. Never again.

I have went to Red Robin in many different locations, but this was my second time here and I was with a bunch of my girlfriends friends for a dinner party. I ordered the Clucks n' Fries and later on when I got home, I ended up getting food poising. Needless to say, we are never coming back here.

The first thing I'd like to mention is that the overall restaurant itself is really nice! It's spacious, colorful, and family-friendly.  The service our party was provided tonight was extremely friendly. Our waitress, Teri, was very approachable and personable. For example, after our table finished coloring the pictures provided with the kids menus (we're all children at heart), we asked Teri whose picture she thought was the best. This just shows how easy she was to talk to!  She made sure we were comfortable and that we had everything we needed.  Lastly, the food was AMAZING. This may sound like something small, but the meat patty in the burgers was bigger than the burger itself, and there was enough cheese to cover the entirety of the patty. This, therefore, prevents us from eating just bun.  Also, you definitely become full for what you pay for, and you don't have to worry about eating your money's worth.  As for the drinks, the freckled lemonade was very tasty. We probably had our cups refilled at least 10 times.  Overall, we had a great experience here! :)

I have been to this particular Red Robin a handful of times and had very little problems with the quality of the food or service. However, earlier today (around 4pm) my mother and I decided to go. When we entered it was pretty slow, there were many open booths, and tables. The hostess/waitress asked for my name and encouraged my mother and I to have a seat in the lobby.  Two men that entered after us were also greeted but were immediately asked by the waitress where they would like to be seated. My mother was very disappointed by this, however, I assumed there must be a good/reasonable reason why they would try to accommodate them even though we arrived first.  In the entire 15 minutes we sat in the lobby, two waitresses stood behind the front podium talking amongst themselves. They even discussed very loudly where they should seat my mother and I (even though there was an entire empty seating section). Finally, the waitress acknowledged us and sat us at a corner table right beside the front lobby. After placing the menus on the table, the waitress walked away. My mother and I looked at each other in complete shock at the lack of courtesy and service. Moments later we decided to leave in order to avoid further issues.  This was a very uncomfortable, and discouraging experience.

I'm not sure what Red Robin was thinking when they place those machines on the table. It's the equivalent of the check out lines at stores now a day. I used to go there for the family environment and customer service. Now if you choose not to use the machine and actually have the waiter take the order you are looked at funny and treated with an attitude. Im busy with my kids and have no time to be a waiter as well. Red Robin needs to go back to human interaction rather than directing people to those machines. Needless to say I'm now going to other restaurants after been a very long time Red Robin customer.

Service here was awful.  I ordered take out for my boyfriend, called, and got a more than less enthused person answered the phone. I asked for two burgers and she just said okay it'll be ready.  I then asked if fries came with it and then she said sassily - "yeah..". Ok thanks.. I get there to pick it up and not one person was helpful. I had to ask three employees where to pick up to go orders. No one showed me where to go but half assed told me vaguely where to go.  The only person that was nice and helpful was who I assume is the manager. EVERYONE ELSE HERE IS SO RUDE. Never again.

I prefer Red Robin's elsewhere.  This location is terrible.  From the barely in high-school staff who really have no clue what is going on, to the waitresses, who don't come back around.   First.  We came here on Saturday afternoon with my son for lunch.  The restaurant was fairly empty.  Maybe 4-5 tables of people.  We said two adults and a highchair is what we needed.  They told us it would be a minute, and walked off.  5 minutes later and were still waiting (mind you, another couple with children came in and were promptly seated), finally they give us a table near the entrance, where we get the draft of the door every time its opened.  This is terrible when its 45 degrees outside.   Anyway, I asked why it took so long to get our table, and I got a blank stare.  Nothing.  Nothing at all.  Not an 'I'm sorry' or some kid of explanation.   We won't be back to this location.

Worst experience. Took 1/2 Hr to wait at the front for the table, 15 mins before a waiter finally came to take our drinks order, another 15 mins before we get our drink and order our food, then 35 mins wait before our food arrive when my kids already fell asleep on the table. Knowing such a slow service, I order fries refill as soon as our food came. Then 15 mins after we finish all our food, the fries refill still hasn't come. The whole time my server never came to check on us. It was a tough challenge to flag my server down finally for 1 drink refill in the course of the whole meal when all our drinks on the table went dry most of the time. We gave up on the fries and wanted our check and leave. Took another 20 mins and 3 request for the check before the manager finally came. He acknowledged there is a problem and try to make it right to give us a discount on the check. That's the 1 star they actually earned The worst of all, the place wasn't packed, there were open table around us most of the time. I have no idea what was the hold up and why our server hiding behind the front of the kitchen most of the time. And the fries refill still hasn't come at the end.:" I could've drive a bit further north to the one in factoria mall and likely finish and be home much sooner
Family always comes here...it doesn't matter which location. Same food taste and service. Have noticed the amount of food given has lessen. But pretty much everything is ok

I don't really have too much to say about this place. It's clean, friendly, and soooo close to my house! The only thing that sucks is that there are no more fries that I can purchase & make them bottomless. Grrr. But oh well! The food is still great!

Extremely disappoint in red robin... They gave me 3 pieces of chicken in my salad and missed my slice of flat bread.  Called back the manager to let him no and he said he'd would have to see the meal, aka me having to drive all the way back up there again.  Horrible horrible to go meal, extremely disappointed & don't recommend.
Typical red Robin. The waiter was good, but not overly attentive. The food was good and everything I expected of the restaurant. Nice place for a casual dinner.

We did a take-out order last night. I've been to this location countless times, but it's gone downhill recently. They burned some of our food- two burgers charred quite badly and garlic toast to go with the French onion soup was completely black on one side and since they put it in the soup too, it's all you could taste. I would not do take-out again from here and if you do, open the boxes and check each item before going home. The only redeeming item was a patty melt that was on point.

i would give it no stars if i could as i just heard a disturbing story from a friend that was kicked out for being gay!? My friend an his husband went for dinner an was told very rudely to sit an wait if they didn't want to sit in the bar area.  as they spoke to the manager on duty he then told my friend that they have been having problems with gays??   wtf i smell a law suit coming your way so sad.
Love going to this location! Staff is always nice and food is always great. It's very busy and there's always. Await time but it's worth it :)  Stacy was my last waitress and she did an amazing job!

For all the raves about Red Robin, I feel like this is one of those amazing American Resturants that's going to go bankrupt when more people realize what low quality service they are getting. At first I thought it was me, but upon reading other reviews first I realize I was not simply being picky.  Twice now I had visited Red Robin in two different locations and found the problems to be exactly the same. They are slow, not like "I had to wait 10 minutes to order" but just super slow from taking the order, bringing the food, getting a server, getting the basics like water and napkins" not to mention even cashing out took awhile... The service was terrible, me and my husband made the most of it and laughed it off but we knew we were never coming back.  Places like this never change, there is no chance it will. It will only steadily get worse until the customers are gone and a new resturant takes over.  We were seated and waited, waited, waited. I don't blame the waitress but management at this point. How do you not know how to hire enough to keep the place moving? The food was delicious, but thats for the one star. And oh yeah, those bottomless fries they like to advertise about? You never see them. If you can wait it out for about an hour you will get about 18 fries in total . Apart of me wants to believe its because of revenue and other people eating more fries than food, but it just feels really cheap tactic and a sign of the times with the economy.  Make sure when you come you bring napkins because this place is so cheap and slow you might not ever see one... Lol.
Just dont...bad service-very slow when not busy. Too loud. And, FILTHY ladies room-nasty.

We asked for the dining area, and the hostess said the bar was open. We asked for a booth, she said the bar had booths. What she failed to mention was that all of the empty booths had dirty dishes on the table! We FINALLY were seated at a dining area booth. I don't know why she kept pushing us to the bar, but it was frustrating.  I ordered a Bonzai Burger and a Cookie Magic Milkshake. It's been a few years since I've eaten here, but I could have sworn that the pineapple ring was grilled, and supposed to be warm, and not right out of the fridge temperature.  The milkshake was disappointing. It looked like chocolate milkshake with cookie crumbles on top. I mixed the shake, and there weren't any cookie bits in it. Also, I could have sworn that it was vanilla based, and the waiter didn't know. He brought a "new" one back, but it just looked like the cook dumped the contents out, added some cookie bits, then put it back in a new glass and sent it out.  I don't know if I'll eat at this location again.

I am a fan of Red Robin food and shakes, & a Huge fan of the service; all of the above consistently exceeds our expectations.  High fives to Red Robin because they seem to have friendly & proficient service at every location I can recall- and this one is no exception. :-)

I am continuously amazed at how many people this place can feed in an hour! We arrived at 6pm on a Saturday (so right before the rush) and were seated fairly promptly. The menu has gone through some changes, and has some annoying gimmicks, but overall, we were able to order exactly what we wanted and the food was good. Our server was a little slow, but hard to blame him as it was so busy. Minus one star because I ALWAYS want another basket of FRESH sweet-potato fries with my turkey burger - and another table STOLE my order!  How RUDE!  My waiter said he put in the order as soon as my food came out.  I just wish they would get this part of the show together... my only gripe with Red Robin.

Former coworkers set up a get-together lunch. Since 5 of us work from different locations now, we decided on the most central location, Renton. At first, I wish they would choice something healthier. But, I was actually craving for burger!  Obviously, I am a burger kind of gal! Location: It's in the new developed area called Landing in Renton. If you know where LA Fitness in Landing. You will find Red Robin. It's a great set up, isn't it? :-P Decor: Booth all around by windows and tables/chairs in the middle. Decorated with the signature color RED. We were seated very close to the bathroom.  Food: I had prime chophouse. I thought it was middle rare. But, it felt more like middle well. The meat was dry. My coworker had to dump some good amount of BBQ sauce on. Though, I had to say the fried onion really added good crunch to the burger. I thought that part was good. All you can eat fries was nice, but how many time can you really refill? I only did once!  Service: The service was a bit slow during lunch hour. Our server was doing a good job taking care of us. It was very accommodating that each of us got our own check.  They don't have the best burger. But, this is definitely a place to hang out and relax.

I am a fan of red robins but this place has one of the WORST customer service I ever had in a restaurant. I came here a couple times before and I noticed they always forgot a couple things in my orders, like a soup, extra sides, etc. Nevertheless, I decided to give them another chance. Yesterday however was absolutely horrible. I went in for to-go to get a quick grab before I went to work. It was a little after lunch time, around 2:30pm, I put my order through the bartender girl and asked how long it would take since I had to quickly go to work right after. She told me it would only be15 mins which is reasonable so I paid and waited. After 15 minutes passed, I checked with the bartender and she told me they were packing my order so it would be out soon. Another 15 minutes later I wait by the table and the bartender gives me looks but doesn't even check on my order. I asked a server passing by if he could just quickly check my order since I waited 30 minutes. At this point I was running late so I asked them if it wasn't ready yet then I might have to refund the money since I had to go to work soon since it was way past the wait time they told me it would be. The bartender, "oh so attentive", overhears me talking to the server, stops the drinks she was making and stomps over to me and yells "I told you. I said earlier the food was coming, it's getting packed. I told you this already, it's coming okay?" with her fingers pointing and shaking at me. This obviously raised a lot of attention making the place really uncomfortable and for me, really shocked that she was being extremely rude. I understand she was a bit busy so she was probably frustrated but don't ever, EVER give your customer an attitude. You represent the business. I told her that she didn't need to give me an attitude and she rolled her eyes, gave me the bitchiest look and went back to tending the bar. So dear Red Robin, idk wtf you guys are doing about customer service but you guys should get your shit together and try to hire more appropriate people because I am never coming back to this place again. The most disgusting service I ever got in a restaurant, I lost my appetite after I got the food. Worst impression a restaurant has ever left on me.

So rounding up to a 3 because I'm gonna cut them a little slack. It was Saturday night & they were busy. The food was alright but the service was subpar tonight.  Arrived at approx 5:05pm. Lobby full of people waiting. Told it would be about 20 min.  I went to the ladies room while waiting & passed 4 open tables!!!  The ladies room itself was a mess.  Paper on the floor & one stall almost out of toilet paper. I reported that it needed attention on my return to the lobby.  It did end up only being 15 min wait for table. Taken back to the corner near the kitchen where we had sat before. Noted that the floor wasn't slippery like last time.  Our server must have been new because she seemed overwhelmed & uncomfortable.  Beverages were slow to arrive. Check back came too soon. Offer of second beverage came too late.  On leaving there were 3 open tables in our area &'yet the lobby was full of people waiting for seats. Obviously there is a missing link in assigning tables.  Will I go back to RR.  Will I go back to this one, maybe not. :(

It's gonna sound like a broken record, reiterating much of what some recent review have said about this RR. Great location , salty fries , inattentive server , indifferent service , badly made burger , dirty bathroom . Aside from the location part, it's pretty negative.  I've patronized RR for over 30 yrs, I feel I'm qualified to complaint. The last couple of times to this particular locale has got to be the worst (food-wise) in all my experience with RR. From the get-go, the maitre'd seem genuinely surprised that two adults don't want to sit at the bar. No bad attitude, just a surprised look on her face. Then came our server, D, who seemed all flustered before even greeting us. Must've been a busy busy shift. Everything from burgers to fries were very (extremely) salty. Hey, aren't we all suppose to eat healthier, cutting down on the sodium?! Apparently the line cooks decided we were all salt-deprived. Patties were way under-cooked. Also I literally spent more time waiting for food, drinks and our server than eating my dinner. As some of her tables starts emptying out, she got harder to track down. Forgetting the requests for sauces, refills on fries and drinks (even after acknowledging our requests). I know wait-staffs work hard, but I'm not in a habit of training or tracking them. The attitude of the staffs were cordial, if not pleasant; which is alright with me. And maybe the only saving grace for this RR. My last time here was last year around March. Why so long between visits? That last time here, their kitchen "crashed". Why? I don't know. But when you see the manager cooking and wait-staff all confused, it can't be good. Again, their attitude was the only thing preventing a 1-star rating. It'll be a looong time before I'll give this RR again go around.
Great service  reasonable food; Natalie is a gem--unbelievable bartender! ! Great place! !

We had a gift certificate and that is the only reason to go here. Cheese burger tasted like the frozen patty that it was, the fries are well, good steak fries but so what. Why do people go here? If you want to go to a chain go to (NW Chain)Bob's Burgers and Brew they have great tasty burgers, fresh Salads and crispy Fish and Chips and they cost just about the same but they are way better and way way way bigger portions and well... BETTER!

Now I usually don't pay attention to low rated stars for popular places because the residents of greater Seattle love to complain about the smallest things. When eating a restaurant the food is president so here's my quick review of this Red Robin.  I didn't think you could mess up a burger, but they did. I ordered the blue American (I think) and the onion buns were so large you could not taste any parts of the burger. I could barely taste the blue cheese, and it was extremely sloppily made. The fries were way too salty but not too bad. This was one of the worst burgers I have ever had.  I only give two stars because the waitress and other staff were very nice.

We showed up at 6:45 on Christmas eve.  The waitress was horrible.  After our food came at 7:15pm, the waitress never showed up to our table.  After 7:30pm, we asked her to refill, she said the kitchen was closed.  I asked her why didn't you tell us the last call.  She said she forgot.... Then the manager came to an apologize and discounted our meal. Two stars for the waitress and Five stars for the manager.

Tried going there with our family today (6 people) I checked in and they said it would be 15 minutes.....25 minutes we ask how long it would be and the non trained hostess girls looked at each other like we had just asked a hard math question. They didn't answer us. They kept seating everyone else that had walked in after us which was like 5 other groups/parties. The one girl hostess told the (we think manager guy) that we had been waiting and he just gave a look of "don't give a f**k" and kept seating everyone else. No one was helpful or friendly and couldn't even give us an answer when we asked how long it would be. We left and went to the nearby restaurant Papaya....and was seated right away and the staff was very friendly! Will never go to or recommend this red robin as the employees clearly don't care about customer service and aren't properly trained.

Red robin, why must you disappoint me so? We came for lunch. It was fairly busy but we were seated right away. When our server finally came over he forced us to use the table top computer thing because they were having some kind of competition. If we had wanted to order our appetizers on that, we would have done so ourselves. Drinks took forever to get to us and we had to ask three times for extra napkins. Meanwhile a manager was literally standing 5 feet from our table our entire meal and never once asked to see if we needed anything. Drink refills were slow and he had to keep coming back to ask what we wanted. We waited 39 minutes from when we ordered to when we received our food. I upgraded to the garlic parm fries and they looked like they were yesterday's. My burger had barely any BBQ sauce on it despite ordering the whiskey river BBQ burger and it was like warm. It was very lackluster. When he brought out the kids meals he got one of the sides wrong. He then argued with me when I told him they had asked for apples and not oranges. Finally he looked at his book where he wrote it down and realized yes, in fact they had asked for apples. Probably top 10 worst service I have gotten, ever. Definitely won't be back.

My boyfriend and I live close to this red robin and eat here often. Every time we are always happy with our food. I suggest trying the banzai burger. The employees are all super nice and the restaurant it very clean!

Server Alex was great. Cooks are morons. I am not sure how you can mess up steamed broccoli and a vegetarian wrap or even their fries which they are famous for.  Fries were cold, wrap had barely anything in it and the spinach tortilla was unchewable.  (update: I'm feeling sick from my bad wrap. My girlfriend literally only got steamed broccoli that had some red goop on it. Presumably tomatoes? And now she is sick too. Disappointed more than anything because the server Alex really was super great.)

We had a great experience here. We were seated in the bar and had a business meeting. The service was great and the food was exactly as ordered. When the meeting was done, family joined us and we had a second meeting. Perfect all the way around. Very happy with our experience here.

Our first time at this location and definitely our last. 1.) We had a large party of 12, so we called as we were leaving home and told them we would be there in 30 minutes. The hostess said no problem, she put us on the list and start getting our table ready. It would only be a 5 minute wait once we got there. We arrived on time and found out that after we called a baseball team came in, so they gave our table to them. We then had to wait for 40 minutes to be seated. 2.) While we were waiting, we saw an ad for a gift card deal: purchase X amount in gift cards and get free tickets to see the new X-men movie. Great! We were planning on spending a large amount and a member of that party was planning on seeing the movie later that week. We went up to the front desk and purchased $200 in gift cards. AFTER the transaction was processed, the restaurant employee told us that they couldn't be used for 24 hours. That information would have been helpful before spending $200. The manager came over and processed refund. Its been 3 days and the money still hasn't been put back in the account that was used to purchase the gift cards. 3.) About half of our party ordered milkshakes or root beer floats and the other half ordered water or lemonade. The waters and lemonades were brought to the table within 5 minutes. 10 minutes after those had been delivered, we asked the waiter how much longer our milkshakes/floats would be and he said, "Oh didn't I tell you? Our ice cream machine is broken." I'm not sure if he took our orders knowing full well that he couldn't deliver them, or if he found out afterwards and just didn't tell us. 4.) Since we had arrived hungry and waited 40 minutes longer than we had expected, we were starving by the time we sat down. To keep the 6 kids in our party happy, we asked for 4 orders of bottomless fries right away. The kids devoured the fries and we asked for more (they're bottomless fries, right?) We never got any more fries. We must have asked our server at least 5 times and even grabbed another employee and asked for some, but they never came. Our server kept saying, "Oh, let me go grab those fries for you" but he never came back with fries. 5.) I'm not sure if our server was overworked or just bad at his job, but after our food was delivered he disappeared. We all finished eating and sat there for 20 minutes, waiting for the bill. Finally one of our party got up and searched the restaurant for our server to ask him for a bill and some boxes. He brought the bill but no boxes. I got fed up and just walked straight back into the kitchen and got the boxes myself. The one positive of this experience? The food we got was pretty good. Although it seems this was more due to luck than anything else, as the woman at the table next to us was served a completely blackened chicken burger.

Pretty good lunch today, had the Chicken Ensenada with the spicy ranch dressing, the service was better then before, over the last year the service has been pretty bad, hopfully this is a trend in the right direction...

The food was awful! Mac and cheese was dry and crunchy. Ribs so dry it was like chewing hay. Burger was dry too! Suck! Oh and when the server asked how it wS she just walked away.... Didn't even respond to our complaint.

Went today with my co-workers, we expected a quiet Tuesday lunch but it was not, the place was pretty full.  Service was very good.  food was predictable. Prices seemed a tad high but it's sit down service. Not sure I'll be back, just not my typical joint.  5 guys is also very good burgers and much cheaper.

We came here several times on weekends,  the drinks are pretty good, the hamburgers are delicious! Is family friendly, but usually we went to the bar area, today  our waitress didn't ask for any sauce for our fries, didn't gave us a knife, no napkins And 5 potatoes fries ( yes we can order more but 5? Really?) we ask for a box they never bring us, we asked for honey mustard they have to us after 20 minutes, the knife we had to go to the bar and ask for one.

Red Robin is usually pretty consistent, so... there's no reason for me to talk about their food in detail. The cool thing about this location is that we stopped by because a friend was meeting up with 15-20 people at about 10pm, and the employees at this already pretty busy RR were able to easily handle the surprise. The "normal" food was pretty good as usual, but they weren't that great when it came to figuring out what was and what wasn't gluten-free (even though they have a special menu to address allergies). I think my boyfriend's burger was wrapped in lettuce because of the gluten intolerance he mentioned, but they still allowed him to order a burger that included breaded fish. He didn't realize that it would be breaded, and the employee apparently didn't think about it. We've encountered one other RR employee (in Woodinville) who WAS super careful when it came to allergies/intolerances, but looks like that's probably not the norm. We're not likely to go back anytime soon because we don't spend much time in the area and he wasn't that happy with how ordering "safe food" went, but for some big groups this RR can be a great gathering place.

We waited 20 minutes for a table on a Sunday night. This was puzzling because we could see many empty tables. Once seated we didn't receive menus but since we had looked at the menus while we waited, we were able to get our order in without them. There were many tables that remained dirty  with used dishes, one stayed that way the whole time we were there. Once you reach the 45 minute mark waiting at a table for a meal with a 2 year old you're pretty much ready to leave. Our order did finally come up, but they forgot the cheese pizza. At 60 minutes we were walking out of the restaurant with our order.The manager told us it was because they had overlooked our order. By this time the restaurant was about a quarter full so I'm not sure how that could happen.  I gave them one star because they comped us the meal.

I don't know what it is about Red Robin - any Red Robin - but it's always a let down, and this location is no exception. Food is meh. Fries are cold until you get your refill basket. The food always sounds better than it is, and I don't know why, but the burgers always taste kinda funky. Service is average at best. I never choose to go here, but when I'm with a group and they want to go, I always hope I misjudged it on previous visits, only to be proven correct once again. The onion ring tower is it's only saving grace. I could down several of those! To be honest, I just don't get the attraction, or how these stay in business. Probably okay for happy hour, as they looked to have an okay beer selection, and, of course...the onion ring tower.

We moved to Renton from Puyallup in July. We go to Red Robin at least three times a month. We LOVE Red Robin - their bruschetta chicken and their whiskey river bbq burger is delicious, paired with their bottomless fries with ranch and campfire sauce on the side.  This location is all fine and dandy if you're here just to hang out and look at the menu. The waiters and waitresses are rude, and to go orders take LONGER than if you were to stay and eat. I will say that i have not experienced the "restaurant" side of the building - we have only ever eaten in the bar.  The last (and final) time we ate there - well, tried to, was on a Saturday night at 10 pm. Literally sat down at ten in the bar (they close at 11) at a table right across from the actual bar. There were probably 4 other customers (couples or families) in the bar area. The waitress came over, took my boyfriends' drink order (one beer) while i said i'd just have water for now. Literally 25 minutes later, we are still waiting on his beer. The waitress had walked past us twice without saying a word, not to mention a couple of other employees. The two bartenders are chatting to themselves. The couple that sat down behind my boyfriend that had walked in after us had already received their drinks and had their order taken. He gets frustrated. I get impatient. He wants to leave. I say "Five more minutes. If at ten thirty, if she doesn't come back, we're leaving." Ten Thirty rolls around and we get up, i grab my purse, and walk out. The two bartenders stop talking and look at us, but say nothing.  We've gone to the Tukwila location since then, and they have been excellent. Food well cooked, employees have a great attitude and are happy to recommend their favorite choices. Never too busy. We will definitely be going to the Tukwila location from now on.

I've been going to Red Robin now for over 15 years. I've always loved their selection and the fun family orientated environment it brings. But after my experience today, I don't know if I'll ever visit a Red Robin again.  We attended the one at the landing in renton tonight for my cousins 15th birthday. There were about 15 of us at a table. It started out great; got our drinks and appetizers fast. Halfway through my drink I noticed my glass was dirty; caked on food near the top, I was extremely grossed out. Then came our meals...... I ordered the clucks and fries buffalo style. Now I've ordered this plenty of times and each time it comes cooked in buffalo sauce. Mine came out as regular strips and two cups of sauce on the side. I told him and not only did he not offer to take it back but the sauce looked and tastes like 90% oil, 10% buffalo sauce. Then my uncle who ordered buffalo wings, ( which he got 15 mins after everyone already got their food) came out with just.... Drumroll..... Sauce on ONE wing. Sent it back. They put sauce on two more wings .* rolls eyes*  During the meal, none of us got refills unless we stopped him and asked for one. On top of that we didn't get napkins until AFTER we finished eating. Not one time did the waiter clear any of our plates, even our appetizer plates were on the table when we left. He brought our desert out with the tables full of empty plates and glasses. And even after desert nobody cleared our tables. Not once did anyone apologize.  It was the worst service I've had ever, and I will not recommend this location to anyone. Thanks for making a family dinner an unpleasant one.

One thing about this place. The manager cares. I've been several times. It's close, it's delicious. It's exactly what I expect from a Red Robin. A little while ago I popped in and they weren't able to seat me. Sometimes the location can be a little busy. I sent an email to the Red Robin corporate office. They forwarded it to the manger. I got a personal call! Anyway. Overall I'm happy with how they work to resolve issues. I've also always enjoyed the food there.

Went here not too long ago for my boyfriends birthday. Our burgers were good and our daughters food wasn't too hot. Our waitress was beyond nice and probably the best service we ever had in a while. She also had a child around the same age as our daughter so it was fun talking about food choices and beverages with her. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because we had asked to get garlic fries instead of regular fries. They had given us fries with a slice of melted American cheese on top. Barely any garlic....I've ordered garlic fries there before and didn't have this happen so I'm not sure if a cook decided to experiment...
Who doesn't love Red Robin?? This location is great. The staff is nice, and attentive. And The Landing has a little bit of everything. I could spend my whole day at The Landing - and I have!
When I'm at a restaurant and I ask the waitress for another glass of water and he gives me a dirty look

I only place to go orders here.  There's ALWAYS someone parked in the clearly-marked takeout-only parking spot that isn't getting food to go.  You know, the selfish and lazy pieces of trash that can't walk an extra 50 feet.  To the management: why aren't you enforcing the parking rules?  And as far waiting times: I ordered by phone at 5:10 and was told my order would take 15 minutes.  Well, it's 5:52 and I'm still waiting.

We went in on the 26th of December after running errands. It was decently busy, however it was outside of Lunch or Dinner (in between) so not terrible and no wait at all (bar was about 60% full and restaurant about the same). We sat in the bar and it took almost 10 minutes for us to be able to order drinks from one of the 3 people behind the bar. Got drinks fairly quickly and then ordered food. I told the server that I was having blood sugar issues and would like my fry "refill" right away. It took 30+ minutes, and it all came out at the same time.  30+ minutes for two burgers, one of which was a garden burger that takes about 2 minutes to heat up (and was barely warm when I got it)..... Food tasted good, although it would have been nice for the server to come back and ask how it was. Or offer us more fries, etc., before we started to pay.  With the amount of time it took to get the food, I started looking around at all the decor. That is when I noticed the huge amount of dust and cobwebs on all of the wall art, ceilings, ceiling fans, window sills, wall molding, blinds, etc. It was disgusting! I walked to the restroom and the remainder of the restaurant did not appear to have this much ick. Seemed odd.  I called the manager over as I was about to go out the door and pointed out the cobwebs and dust to him. He said that the dust was from the construction during their recent renovation - which was months ago. I asked then where were the cobwebs from that had obviously taken a long time to collect that many (I even took pictures of it because it was so gross and I couldn't believe it). He had no answer.  It is obvious that this store does not care at all or take pride in its appearance. They are in a busy location and it appears that think that as long as they are making money, why should they care? There are so many other places to eat at the landing that cares about guests and the cleanliness of their restaurants - go somewhere else. If you are really craving RR, there are plenty of others in the area that you can get to within 15 minutes or so that care about cleanliness and customer service and food wait time.

Went in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. First problem- it was FREEZING! The person who sat us- the "hostess" was rude- had her phone hanging out in her back pocket and you could tell she couldn't care less whether she helped us or not. After that we were finally showed to a booth and the person who helped us was nice until it came time to pay the bill. We had a Red Robin Royalty card that when we used it last a few weeks back we were told that next time we came in would be our free meal. However- the waitress told us that for "whatever reason" our card was no longer active and they couldn't honor our free meal that we earned. She gave us a new card and after looking at it more closely it was completely different.  Red Robin apparently changed their loyalty program and deactivated all the cards and conveniently it's our fault! It's crap and truthfully the food isn't that great and we plan on NEVER going back there again.

I came here with my cousin for dinner Christmas Eve.  I've been to other Red Robin locations before, so this was not my first time here.  I ordered the Simply Grilled Chicken sandwich.  The chicken was not cooked thoroughly and was cold.  I told my waiter, who called the manager over.  Apparently, the kitchen was closed by then since it was Christmas Eve, so they couldn't cook another sandwich, so I got my order comped and a $10 gift card.  I appreciate getting my order comped and it was nice to get a gift card, but I'm not sure I would come back.  Also, service was not that great-our waiter was MIA most of the time.

Oh how the mighty have fallen       Red Robin used to one of my absolute favorite places to stop in for a burger, but my last couple of experiences have made me rethink that previous belief that they are a great place. Last night me and My soulmate stopped in for a quick dinner before heading out for a buddy's poker night and were both left feeling dissatisfied. First off our server was borderline rude, she didnt give her name, was obviously rattled from the half empty bar area she was sharing with two other servers and we had to ask for our menus twice. It took ten minutes for me to get my beer and another five minutes on top of that for my girls very mediocre drink to arrive. the food arrived decently quickly after we ordered. my burger was very OK, nothing fancy but nothing to hate about it. my main gripe is the portions at Red Robin now. When did they start giving you a pathetic amount of fries? i ordered a 14$ burger and it arrived with literally 10-12 fries on the plate. i asked for some more ( you know trying to capitalize on the "bottomless" aspect) after another almost ten minutes our server returned. with another basket with literally 9 fries in it. I know theyre probably used to people taking advantage of the fries but COME ON, im a grown man paying over 20$ for a meal and a beer and you cant give me a decent portion of fries??

Its Red Robin. Burgers fries drinks. Food is fine, nothing special, lots of burgers to choose from, some chicken items, everything comes out to like $10-15 each. ITs an expensive burger.. Busy at lunch. You can order almost anything to go... But its never ready in 15 minutes as they say, sometimes I've waited an additional 15 minutes for them to make it. And there's not even a real waiting area, since you pick it up in the bar. So if you are under 21, can you not stand there to pay?  They can handle large parties, requests can be made morning of, or maybe day before if u want to make sure. Note to self, pay cash when in a large party. Wait time to pay by credit card can be 15-20 min...  Super healthy options include... ... Water... and steamed broccoli.  Burgers can be made with whole wheat buns, and you can substitute steamed broccoli for your fries.

Honestly, I didn't even bother looking at the Yelp reviews for this particular Red Robin because I've been to so many at so many different locations & I loved everything about them! BUT - this location? No. I'm actually sitting in the restaurant as I'm typing this Yelp review. When we first came in, no one greeted us. The person who wrote our names down for the wait time was the only nice person we came in contact with all night. The female who sat us was rude. The server was okay, didn't really bother with us, which was kind of a "whatever" kind of thing. He took our order & we waited. At least 4 other families came in AFTER us (over 5 people in each family) and they all received their food before us. We waited 45 minutes for our food. I, myself, am not a prude when it comes to mistakes in the kitchen or mistakes on the waiter's behalf.. However, no one informed us about anything that was going on. If the waiter would've just informed us that he made a mistake or the kitchen made a mistake I would've been fine. Things happen. I spoke to a female manager & she basically just rudely brushed us off. She said she was going to check on what was going & never came back. The waiter came out with the food & still no explanation on what was going on. Placed the food down & left. We ate, the food was COLD. The waiter came back, gave us the bill & we finally asked him why it took so long. Apparently the kitchen was so busy, they lost our ticket. We told him we were upset & he brought a different manager out who took off $10 off our $35 bill. Honestly, after such a horrible experience I'm upset I had to pay them, period. All in all, this Red Robin does NO Justice to the others I have been to. Please, hire some workers with basic common courtesy skills & managers who actually give a damn about the customers.

Zero stars would be great for this location.  I took my bf here for a birthday dinner on memorial day. I understand it is a holiday but everyone seemed to be getting service just fine besides us.  We were the first table seated in our row. Server named Jessica came up right away and asked if we were ready. After asking for some time it took her a whole 20 mins to come back and get our orders. One of our burgers was incorrect,  no big deal to us, it happens. We asked for more fries while we waited for the order to be corrected,  they never came. 20 mins later we got the correct burger and still had to repeat the order for the fries 2 more times after! We never were asked for refills. The tables next to us came and went and we were still waiting for fries and then by then we wanted the check so we could leave. The place was so busy with food orders racking up at the kitchen that the manager was helping them run food yet no one else seemed to want to help get food out faster. Some just stood there yelling at people. No team work at all. Next the checks were incorrect.  We nicely let her know to move just one item to a different tab. We had two checks yet she would only give us one itemized receipt.  2nd time she brought us the corrected checks they were even more messed up and I physically had to write down who was paying for what on a piece of paper for her!  3rd time and 3 charges later she handed us 3 different receipts with 3 different prices and still only one itemized receipt! No steps taken to make sure everything was clear. We then took our issue to the manager who said quote "well you confused her when you started changing everything". I was dumbfounded that he would blame us even when we wrote everything down for them.  So an hour later after we were done eating and my bf birthday ruined we finally left in a heated rage and I vowed never to eat at this location EVER AGAIN!

Wish I could give a zero, but sadly I can't. I waited seated 15 minutes, still no one helped me. So I used their table thing, and hit call server still no one. Finally someone came and took my order...... the food was okay.

I am a frequent Red Robin customer around all the surrounding locations and this was sadly one of the worst experiences I have had horrible service and dirty tables left uncleared  I went for my birthday and sat down at the bar. We were greeted with a smile by the bar tender and asked what we would like to drink. He took a good 5 minutes to bring us the water we ordered and didn't even poor us our beers. We then got up and moved to one of the tables in the bar area hoping to get some better service and we were not talked to by anyone for literally 15 minutes. Though we were passed about 20 plus times. When we finally did get service it was still the bartender which was frustrating to say the least where he finally poored and brought us our beers.  The food was excellent as always but it is safe to say that I will not be back to this location. It was the night of July 2nd and I hope the bartender gets a talking to by one of the managers...this was pitiful.

Ugh, I used to like Red Robin but last time we went the burgers were completely dried out and fries just so so. Service was slow and the place was kinda dirty. I used to love the endless fries and juicy burgers but it was just all stale with much smaller portion sizes. Won't be going back.

Consistently bad. Today was the last straw. Ten minutes to get a table, when they weren't full. Another five to get a server, who announced she would be serving us because the one who should "was overwhelmed." We ordered right then and there because we knew they were slow and had checked the menu while waiting to be seated. The only prompt thing was the water, which I got over my leg and table as she set it in front of me. She didn't even acknowledge the spill, which, at the moment, I was willing to overlook as a mistake by an overworked staff member. Twenty five minutes later, we got a salad with rotten lemons, a greasy-soggy burger, and my soup. Another five minutes to get the full order after we pointed out that my wife was missing her dressing. She did drop by to check a couple of times, which earned her brownie points, but the kicker was the time needed to pay the check: seven minutes to get the check after asking for it (I was timing it by then), fifteen more for me to go looking for my credit card I the kitchen area. That was after being told by the diners at the table beside us that they had received it with their checks, and that was when the manager was doing their close-out. Five years ago they were ok. They always got something wrong with our order, but they were always prompt, courteous, and had reasonably tasty food. It's been several years that they've grown progressively slower, more disorganized, harried, and even a little hostile. Plus the food now is crap I could get at the $5 all-you-can-eat, and not have to wait for it. We're never going back. Looking forward to the next restaurant that opens there when this one finishes imploding.

This location and our server were all bad.  The server messed up everyone's order (there were 4 of us.) And messed up beverage orders as well.  It was a Tuesday night so it wasnt busy at all.
