It still managed to take almost 30 minutes for the food to reach our table. Once it did my burger had quite a bit of pink, and I had asked for it well done.  My friend asked for more fries and they never came, after another minutes or so with no update or fries we gave up and left.  All in all, I will not be coming back to this location unless necessary. There are better Reb Robins around.

The three stars is for the bartender/waiter who served us.  It was 4th of July evening they were short staffed and she was slammed.  Nevertheless she was moving fast and smiling the whole time.  Truly awesome to watch.  The food is another story.  My burger patty was so dry it was like cardboard.  The arugula was yellow and the roasted tomatoes were sour.  Yuck!  The only food highlight was the garlic herb fries.
Good food and GREAT service.  If your party is all over 21 I fully suggest the bar area.  Much less likely to get an out of control child.

I called in a order for my boyfriend to pick up, when he got there he approached the very nice bartender who told him food would be up shortly. so my boyfriend sat at a four top in the bar area to wait (uncool I know) however, he said there was plenty of open tables and a large booth in the corner. a server named Ryder approached him asking him to move if a group wanted his table in which my boyfriend said ok. a few minuets later she asked him to get up because she thought someone wanted the table, no one sat down.  this is a prime example of how not to be a server. instead of giving attitude next time try offering him a water or drink and then asking if he could sit at the bar. i wish he would have gotten a manager right there but he didn't I just hope that they see this and some retraining is issued. Now lets get to the order we ordered two wedge salads and got one, my boyfriend wanted no pickles on his burger which I requested more than once but it had a lot of pickles instead. everything was right on the ticket but your kitchen didn't check the order nor did the wait staff and we know consistency is one of the most important things to be successful.

The first time I went here I felt bad for the waitress as my order was messed up.  Fries came when I made a substitution for something else.   My burger was also over cooked when I asked for Pink which is medium I have been told.   Second time, I got a more expensive burger thinking that it would have a better chance at being pink as ordered.  Once again cooked right through, and I got fries again when I made a substitution.  I will try one more time but really I have to give you a MEH rating.  I will fix it if you get my order right, and I am talking to the cooks, cause the waitress claims she asked for Pink and we got medium.  BTW I was asked if I wanted to speak to the manager which is nice, but I only have an hour for lunch and there is no way I can wait for a new burger.

It's a typical burger and fries kinda place, which I don't mind (It's not fast food.  Although, I wouldn't call it "gourmet.")  I was visiting from SF and taking my cousin, niece and nephews out for lunch.  It wasn't busy, which was good cause we just needed a quick lunch before I had to catch my flight back to California. The kids enjoyed their food.  Burgers were good and hot.  But the fries... all our fries were cold.  That was a bit of a disappointment.  So, we had to ask for fresh fries.  I mean, who wants to eat cold fries?  That just ruins the feel of your whole entire meal.  It wasn't busy, so I could only assume these were left over or were just fries on standby.  No, you pay for a hot meal, you get a hot meal.  That means EVERYTHING on your plate should be freshly cooked, not half of it sitting around to get cold.  I would assume that's common sense.
Worst service I have ever received at a Red Robins.  Our waitress did a terrible job.  Food was as expected I regret not going to Five Guys.

We enjoy eating at Red Robin with friends and family, but the Renton location has the worst customer service I have every experienced at a Red Robin.  Sat for 35 mins waiting to be seated while 3 lunch rush waves arrived and were seated before us.  When I checked with the manager to see why our seating position was being bumped he looked at me and shrugged his shoulders in annoyance without giving any reason or explanation.  It was such a rude and negative gesture that we decided to just leave and move to the Papaya restaurant next door upon which they immediately found a table for us to eat.  On the way out of Red Robin I mentioned to the manager what a negative experience it was and his response was "oh well" and pointed our party to the door.  Never again.  On the other hand we had ended up having an excellent lunch at the Papaya down the street.  Great service, awesome location, quiet atmosphere, and excellent service.

Forced to give a star. When did 5 pieces of avocado cost .99 for a small salad? Red Robin has remodeled and trying for a new improved version....it sucks. The attitude of the waitress that served us was poor. Not only did she not introduce herself but she came up ordering us to give her a drink order. Then everything was an argument about our order. Let's just say the old diner family feeling it used to be is no longer and we won't be returning :/

We have actually walked out of this Red Robin without paying in the past because we could not find a server willing to take our money despite taking to the staffers.... no manager to be found. We have had excellent service here exactly once, and tonight is not looking like our night either. It's close to shopping or I would never end up here at all. We came in tonight and I let our server know we are in a hurry.... got our drinks and a five minute wait to order. Let's see what happens now that the kitchen had our standard order.... this takes eleven to fourteen minutes in Redmond... so sad that I know that. Lol 711 pm  723 Here's my warm marinara for my fries... we'll see if we get food soon.... 725 728 hmmm 731 Food is here and server is nice. Up a star! But she can only find one set of silverware? Yikes.
Average middle of the road burgers for the price. Service was nothing special.

We sat in the bar section ordered and our drinks were brought to us and we placed an order for a slice of pie and a basket of fries. An hour passed and no food came I went to the bar and asked if our food was coming. She bartender said she'd send the manger over. Then, our waitress came out with our food and said my manager is coming to to talk to you. The manager came over said hi and walked away. Worst experience I've ever had. They never even offered to refill our drinks. Horrible service. Never going back.

I like this location whenever we go inside. The food is great when we go in, the service is nice and people are generally very helpful and nice. My complaint and lack of two stars was given because every single time we order To-Go, the food is always mediocre or the order is wrong. I'm not sure why anyone would think that 11 cold fries is a decent side for anything. Honestly, they should do what Applebee's does and bring the food out to you when you park. By doing this, maybe you can take a large scoop/handful of fresh fries and dump them in the container right before taking the food out. It just seems like a better way to go. Also, I recently chose coleslaw instead of fries, and it came with literally NO dressing on it. The campfire sauce for my husband's fries was forgotten and my burger was just okay. Hardly any onion straws and it was super sloppy. Not worth the price. This never happens inside when we sit down. Again, I have no idea what the issue is. Do they think they can just get away with poor food because the person will leave right away? I don't know. I just don't think I'm going to be returning. I'm really disappointed and tonight was kind of the thing that broke the camels back, per say.

I am giving them one star, only because the manager followed us out, to ask us if there had been a problem.  Where do I begin? Let me start by saying I really like Red Robin.  This was the second time I've been to this location at Renton Landing, and NEVER AGAIN!!!  My first visit was on a Saturday evening, and I attributed the poor service and wrong order to the staff being overwhelmed by the weekend crowd, and the fact they had just recently opened.  Our waitress was not friendly, the fries were cold, and we received the wrong burgers.  We decided we could deal with the burgers, but asked for hot  fries.  Our waitress all but grabbed our baskets from us, and slammed down some new ones about 15 minutes later.  She was mad???  We ate, left and hoped things would get better once the staff got rolling.  Seems things have only gotten worse.  I visited again today with my daughter and grandchildren, and it was one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had.  We were greeted by an unsmiling "hostess," who became hostile when we requested a booth.  She seemed to need to confer with a young man who appeared to be the greeter.  She told us there was only one booth we could sit in, despite the restaurant being practically empty.  She took us to a booth right outside the restroom, and when I sat down, I sank into a large "hole" in the seat.   It appeared the springs had broken.  Since we were obviously being ignored, we finally got up and moved to a nearby booth.  Finally, our sassy little waitress (who appeared very put out) came over.  I apologized for moving, and explained the problem with the seat.  She made no eye contact, and informed us that "lots of people sit in that booth, and it's fine."  With that, she slammed some water on the table and left.  Even her thick silver eyeshadow couldn't make up for her bad manners!  We decided we weren't sticking around for the next scene, and walked out.  The manager caught up with us once we were out the door, and we told him about our experience.  He asked us to come back in, and offered to buy our meal.  We declined.  We walked down to the new Torero's, where we were greeted by a smiling hostess, shown to a booth, and had a delicious meal!  Our waitress was wonderful, and we left her a nice tip.  I am truly baffled as to why the manager of the Red Robin allows his restaurant to operate in such a shoddy manner.  He is responsible for his staff, and desperately needs to train and oversee them the way someone in his position should.  Chasing down the customers as they walk out, is like locking the barn door after the horse gets loose. I'll avoid this Red Robin in the future, and from the looks of other reviews, I'm not alone.

I really wish that they would figure out their customer service. You have to plan for at least two hours just to get food and eat dinner at this place. Sometimes it takes them up to 30 minutes just to see you at your table.... And the restaurant is only half-full!!! I've timed it multiple times, and I have yet to be greeted in under 10 minutes. I would come here more often if I knew I would get served faster. One time we sat at the bar and the waitress answered the phone and asked the lady to wait on hold... and then never went back to the phone!!! We even reminded her that she had somebody waiting on hold, and she said "I really don't care it's been ringing all day" WOW!!! 5 for food, ZERO for service!!

Whenever someone says where should we go for dinner I always say " Anywhere but Red Robin ". Last night I was out voted. After waiting 30 minutes for a table they finally called us. We were taken to a booth for 4. There were 4 adults in our party and 2 kids, 1 is 3 and the other is 14 months. They had shoved 2 booster seats into this booth and expected us to cram in there. We had to wait another 15 minutes for a table. After we were seated the service was good. Our waitress brought a basket of fries out with the drinks so the little ones had something to nibble on until the meals arrived. My DIL ordered the Insane Romaine. She predicts it won't be on the menu long. I had the Prime Rib Dip. It was small and there wasn't much meat on it. It was supposed to have horseradish on it but I didn't taste any. I never did like RR fries. They always seem soggy to me. All in all, I didn't have to pay for it, so yay for that. Next time they vote for Red Robin I'll just stay home.

Super busy location at the landing, usually at least 25 minutes. Food is standard Red Robyn, always a crowd pleaser, dishing up a mean chocolate shake per usual. Recommend this location and Red Robyn in general if you have kids, one of those few kid friendly restaurant options at The Landing. An extra plus is the kid's menu is actually a kid price and kid size...unlike other chain restaurants that charge you an arm and a leg for a vat of kids Mac and cheese.

one of the few chains that i enjoy going to is Red Robin (for everyone that keeps calling it Red Robbins... stop it!) consistent food. no matter which location you go to, for $10 you know what you're going to get. i think of my (literally) 200+ visits to any RR i've probably only had to complain about my food 3 times. and of those 3 times - the order was corrected right away. the renton location here is always on point with the food - never had an issues with the service either. the hostess, bartenders, waiters and waitresses are all fast and friendly.  lacks the last star to make it 5 - only cuz i'm fickle and sometimes it takes forever to be seating - only cuz its to pakced! but a great place to grab a burger and bottomless fries before or after a movie.

Some time ago, Red Robin got rid of their burger baskets in lieu of plastic plates and little metal "sleeves' to contain the fries.  Ever since then, it seems the burgers aren't as good.  It's as if they need to keep them "clean" because they are not wrapped in paper any more.  Problem is, it was all the sauce, etc, that made them good.  I don't think it looks better, and it DEFINITELY doesn't taste better.  Also, no more refills on mac & cheese?  Really?  Major bummer for the kiddos, as they are the only reason I go there anymore.  Now I will have to reconsider.  Also, what's wrong with just putting silverware at the table.  You always have to ask for something to eat your food with at Red Robin....Drives me nuts!!!!

the first time i came here i came with friends . my friend also brought her son who is very loud and crazy for a 5 year old . food was good on my end but my friend has a thing if she sees any pink in the burger shell freak out and she asked for no pink . the burger had pink so she sent it back . took about 15  to 20 mins to get her new one after everyone was done eatting so she was upset . talked to the manger and he didnt charge her for her meal . the server was amazing . she was very busy and got us everything we needed . i felt very bad for her because of all the trouble we put her through . but she gets an A+ . But manager was very awkward .  lastnight i came for the first time with my dad after not seeing him in months hoping id get the great serivce i got last time . the lady that was at the front was weird ... she seemed really shy or maybe really didnt like her job . the server was friendly and did a good job . the manager came by and asked me if i wanted any sause . when i explained it to him (because i didnt know the name green chille sause or something) he seemed like he didnt know what i was talking about which i thought was kinda weird , but food was good , service was cool . its over all a chill place to hang out and eat .
Drove 20 min to this location from where I live got here at  9:50 pm they lock all door when they suppose to close at 11 what lazy workers.

If I could, I would give this location zero stars. We waited over an hour for our food, and they didn't give us one of our orders even after waiting. The food was cold and we waited for our appetizer which we had to ask for twice and it came after our entrees were served. When we got our check the orders were wrong and when I told her she needed to put my burger on my check she blamed it on her manager. When I had gotten the "corrected" check she had added a drink I didn't order onto my check. I asked her to fix it again but my card has three charges on it now. The manager blamed us for "confusing" the server. I haven't ever been this angry because of peoples incompetence at a restaurant. I wouldn't recommend this red robin to my worst enemy it was that terrible of service. Jessica was a terrible server. Never going there again.

This location seems to be extremely slow for no apparent reason. Believe me when I say I am not one of those customers who come in to a full restaurant that is extremely busy and expect my food within 5 minutes of sitting down. It doesn't matter what the restaurant looks like though - whether there is 4 tables seated or 14. It takes incredibly long to get our food and even ice water! Our last experience was the worst and most likely the reason I won't return to this location. When we arrived, there were only 2 other tables seated. While ordering and then a little bit afterwards, it got pretty busy. They probably sat 6 or 7 more parties afterwards. After waiting for a long time to even get our water, I started noticing that all the tables were receiving their food. When my boyfriend asked about this, one girl told us our order was lost in the system and that they'd have it come right out. Not sure how it was lost if they got our appetizers and were able to put our order in again without us telling them what we ordered, but whatever. Then, another girl came to apologize and said the manager was taking care of our bill since we had to wait so long. Cool! Once we finally got our food, we again waited several minutes to get a refill of water and napkins. Finally the bill came out and they removed our $6 appetizer, but definitely did not "take care of the bill" as they said. A lot of miscommunication here, along with being forgetful.

This small Red Robin located in The Landing is one of my favorite locations.  It is often busy, but the wait is never long. The servers are friendly and gracious. I have never had a rude or incompetent server there once. They always get our orders right. I usually go with a group of people who all have special requests from burgers done extra well to medium to french fries cooked extra crispy. They have always been able to deliver without fail.  When I want a nice casual meal with friends I am always more then happy to go to this location.

Red Robin is an easy crowd pleasure especially with kids. But a 30 min wait on a Saturday afternoon at 130p when visually we can see whole sections open is rediculous.  You've got paying customers, seat them and serve them.  We will wait but don't think your getting a tip from us. Stupid establishment.

We were seated quickly. That is the only positive thing that I can say. We didn't, know who our server was. The clam chowder was watered down. We didn't get our fry refill and it took 15 minutes just to get the check. To make matters worse we were sitting by the kitchen and food was coming back like boomerangs. I don't know of they are always like this or just had a lack of good management.
After waiting at the bar for 10 minutes without so much as a hello, decided to leave, figured if it took this long to get acknowledged who knows how long I'd have to wait for food.
Came here with my great grandma and my mom it was do loud we did get to talk serves was okay it red robin so food was good. So all in all good but the sound was the only problem

I would have given 4 stars but the service here was SUPER DUPER slow/questionable . I went in for lunch with my sister and the restaurant was about 25% full if that. Luckily we take about 15 minutes deciding what we want to eat. We ended up getting 2 burgers and the guac and salsa appetizer (took 15 minutes to get it), a side of mac and cheese and an alcoholic beverage. The burgers were amazing as usual but they took FOREVER to get to our table, and then when they brought it to our table they told me my side of mac and cheese got messed up so it was being remade, and was free of charge..okay cool. Except when that finally came, there was cheese all over the outside of the bowl, and it was so hot I had to let it cool for 20 minutes. There's a difference in being hot enough for the customer and too hot to eat it. You know how when you order fajitas in a restaurant and all the steam is coming off of it when it comes to the table? Yeah, it was sort of like that. Surprised it didn't melt my eyebrows off.  Would I return? Sure. As long as I had time to kill.

I don't give much low reviews but this particular location was not up to par to the Tukwila location. The server was so weird. Like...weird. When we ordered she didn't write anything down and she looked high and nodded her head weird like she got our order. I knew something would go wrong because she didn't write down our order, my burger didn't come with the gardenburger patty so I had to wait another 10 minutes to get it done. and it didnt come with the extra pickles I specifically asked for the first time I ordered with her. They barely gave us any fries and when we asked for another basket it took like 15 minutes to get them and it was a tiny basket. At this point we were like...forget this...no point in trying, the server just seemed so slow, the gentlemen than brought the first round of the correct orders seemed to understand what I needed. Wish he was our server...I bet our experience would have been a lot better. Anyway, it was upsetting and a lot of waiting for everything. She never asked us what sauces we wanted with our fries so I made a list for her with my sons coloring paper because she obviously would have brought the wrong ones back. Still left her a good tip because I'm a server and I feel bad for leaving one that she really deserves. But anyway, will not visit this location again. Definitely taking my butt back to Tukwila next time, we always get great service at that location.

Just had a very disappointing meal here. We were seated at a table right near, or practically in the kitchen... The kitchen floor was filthy dirty and listening to the kitchen staff yell and bang dishes was a unwelcome addition to our meal, and the service was not much better. After we ordered several employees came out of the kitchen and sat at the table next to us to eat and count their tips.... They laughed and were loud and obnoxious. I was looking around for a manager after our waitress stood chatting with her coworkers and munching on their fries but when I finally saw a manager he also stopped to chat with the table of employees and grab a few fries and I was never able to flag him down to complain.  This is not the first time we ate here and the service has gotten worse each time so I will not be returning.

About a 35 minute wait for a table; which is typical during dinner. There were clearly open tables throughout the restaurant, but there didn't appear to be enough staff to clear them.  Once seated and our order was placed we requested fries which were brought fairly quickly.  The banzai burger I ordered was good but the fries that came with it were not piping hot. The ones that were served while we waited for the burgers tasted much better.

I've been to this location 4 times. Each time the service I receive seems to degrade after each vist. Some how...I keep going back, hoping the present visit will be better.. but I'm disappointed in the end...And no ..I'm not insane!!!!!!!

I took my staff here for our annual holiday get-together.  There were 10 of us including myself and my spouse.  While I usually consider Red Robin to be just an "average" choice, I thought it was ideal for a large group.  There is something on the menu pretty much for everyone, and they have great drink choices (even beyond soda for the non-alchohol-drinkers).  The customer service is also excellent.  When I didn't like the beer that I had ordered, our server exchanged it for a different type, no questions asked.  Same thing when someone in our group accidentally ordered a Long Island Iced Tea, thinking it was really iced tea, and not a big mug of tons of alchohol!  Our server changed it quickly and efficiently and without making a big deal about it, as my co-worker was embarrassed about his mistake.  We got our appetizers promptly, but then our meals took a long time.  To keep people happy, our server put out a few baskets of complimentary steak fries for us to munch on.  She was a real professional! Best of all, it was affordable, and I got to treat my group without "breaking the bank"!

Phone rang and rang, @ least 2 mins, only to be placed on hold, ONLY to be transferred over to a rude bitchy woman in the bar who proceeded to tell me how "busy" she is. I don't REALLY care. I'm hungry. Very unprofessional, horrible service, seemed as if I was infringing upon her night because she was "so busy". I was placed on hold because THEY were OUT of what I wanted. Somehow that was my fault too, and since she was "SO BUSY", she couldn't possibly wait for me to try and pick something else out. So frustrating and unacceptable. They need a specific way to order to go. Maybe take tips from Applebees, and have someone specifically do To-Go orders, and even bring them to you like THEY do. Also, there is no way to order online, so you have to be subjected to them huffing and puffing while they wait for you to place an order because they are "SO BUSY!"  AND because I've placed orders to go in the past, they are usually rushing you, and ALWAYS forget something you were specific about, and they also serve cold nasty food vs. dining in. This location SUCKS!  Lastly, when dining in, one of the rude waitresses cornered me, and asked me why I didn't tip her MORE?  Um, maybe your cold demeanor and haphazard service. I used to be a regular dining in and to go, but I won't be returning... tonight THE ROCK got my money. Too bad. THEY weren't "So Busy" B#&*$!!!

I would pay not to go here ever again.  The staff were all fat and annoying and dirty.  With the exception of the gay fat version of Bruno Mars.  He was interesting and not really annoying, but then he was just a hostess not responsible for horrible service.  We got cold chicken frozen in the middle, a broken glass and half our order missing after waiting over an hour.  The bussers and servers chased eachother around and laughed and joked the entire time while we had to sit and stare at dirty tables all around us.  It sucked.
GM called me and fixed it. Glad to know people still care about customer service. Red Robin has gotten my business back! Thanks Mark! See you next time I'm in town!

The fist thing after sitting down and looking at the menu, I was asked for my ID? I have to say, I don't look a day over 60. When I said are you serious? The wonderful friendly waitress explained that if you don't want to show your ID you will be tossed out immediately. The food was mediocre but tolerable, however, I can assure you that I will never, ever eat at a red robin again.
Had to wait 20 minutes for a table almost missed the movie I wanted to see the service was good but the wait was long.

Customer Service on par with Maggiano's Little Italy! Absolutely marvelous! Kenny waited my table. Stopped by at the opportune times and left me alone just like he should have. Perfect day. Now, the not so perfect part...all my fault and praises for the establishment! Left my phone behind today. Came back an hour later to find it had already been bussed and put in the restaurant safe. Now knowing their procedure for lost/found valuable articles, I'll now give them a great thumbs up for watching out for my stuff! Of course being a courteous customer always helps. Come back as soon as you notice it missing.

waited and waited for the fries refill, never came.  guac burger was devoid of guac. Slopped over with sweet relish.  my son and I both had stomach aches soon after not finishing our burgers. Overall, a not very pleasant experience especially for the price you pay.

Usually have the cheese sticks and a Bonsai (sp) burger, and they are consistently very good.  Wife limes the salad choices, and the kids like chicken strips (clucks and fries).  Don't care for the strawberry lemonade; drinks should not be crunchy.  Good atmosphere, courteous service crew, normally quite clean.  I've ordered takeout, so one word of advice: don't order fries with takeout; they get soggy in the packaging because of the heat.  Burgers are great for takeout, and surprisingly inexpensive compared to fast food.

My office is near here, so we often order lunch from at this location (take-out). The food is always fresh to order, comes with everything it was supposed to (seems to be a problem with take-out orders), and is always ready in a timely manner. They also have a pretty good menu, not to big and overwhelming, but has something for everyone. This is our office's favorite place for lunch! We will definitely be back

Sorry, RR, but you're getting taken down a notch. Stopped in the other night for a late night nosh.  My husband specifically wanted to go to RR so he could get a plate of nachos.  So, he was disappointed to see that RR recently changed its menu and is no longer serving nachos.   (He was so disappointed, in fact, that had we not already ordered and been served drinks, we would have just left.) If it was just that one menu change, the star would probably still be in tact.  But, we noticed a lot of other changes, too, that did not please us.  For example, there used to be a number of pasta dishes on the menu, and these are also no longer there.  Now, I admit, 90% of the time when I go to RR, I order a chicken sandwich of some sort -- and my husband orders a burger.  But, it was nice to have the other dishes as a menu option -- for example, when one of us was in the mood for his/her "usual" and other was not.  Having these no longer available will probably mean we do not go to RR as often. Also, on the night when my husband did not eat the no-longer-available nachos, I was not feeling particularly hungry and so just ordered a bowl of the chicken tortilla soup.  And, it was a good thing I was not feeling particularly hungry because the serving was small!  Really small!  So small, in fact, I had to ask if it was really the "bowl" I'd ordered as  I thought I might have accidentally been served a "cup" instead.  A bowl of soup should be a small meal, not a side dish.  And this was definitely side dish size.  I shudder to think of what the "cup" looks like.  Also, the soup was not served with a roll or even a couple of lousy saltines.  It has definitely been my experience elsewhere that soup is usually served with something of that ilk.. Our server was a good sport and put up with all our griping.  But, the evening, overall, was a disappointment.  RR is one of our mainstays and we will be back.  It just might be a while.

Here is another, just like the others..  This like every other Red Robin across the country.  Always consistent, always the same, and that isn't a bad thing.  Once in a while when you get that crave for hamburgers and endless fries, it's nice to be able to grab a quick burger.  This place is nice, clean and convenient.

I have to say that like every other American, I love Red Robin, but every time I go to this location, the service isn't that great. My order is usually messed up and the waiters are always acting like it is a hassle to get me a drink refill or anything else. I honestly believe it is just this location because I have been to others and have always received better service elsewhere. I gave them multiple chances thinking that it might have been an off day but seems this way every time.

apparently they hired the current hostess simply because she's not ugly... on the outside that is... this dummy obviously wasn't trained to be polite.... I went there only because my six year old wanted to... I also had my twins in the stroller... they way it talked to me will prevent me from ever stepping foot in their establishment again.. just put a sign that says NO STROLLERS to save anyone the misfortune of having to talk to that crash test dummy.. both thumbs down

One of the worst overall dining experiences I've had in a long time. It starts off with us ordering drinks, of course. My lady friend asks for a Sprite and I ask for a water. Guess what we end up getting?? We Both get some kind of carbonated drink that is clearly neither water nor Sprite. We mention this to one of the waitresses and she takes our drinks and after about 10 minutes she comes back with what tasted more like Sprite but still didn't seem entirely so. Since when do restaurants water down soft drinks? Our waitress was extremely awkward and borderline rude; I suspect she was a new employee but even so, shouldn't kindness and a smile be present even if she hasn't yet memorized the menu? She would come ask us if we needed anything: the first time, she held her hands together and she asked me in a way that made me feel like I was her boss, like she feared I was going to shout at her. She spoke barely audible and with the loud atmosphere that is typical of Red Robins, made communicating with her difficult. The second time she asks us if we're alright, we were eating and clearly had no drinks on the table (another waitress had taken them to replace). How does she not notice this? We're eating without any drinks... Food was ok, I got an average burger and mac & cheese that had no flavor whatsoever while my companion got a chicken burger which she herself said was too small, and this is coming from someone that weighs about 90 lbs. All that wonderfulness for $27 and a minimal tip.
The teriyaki chicken burger was soooo good along with the chocolate milkshake. The thing I disliked was waiting 20 minutes for my food to come & the customer service.

Renton needed a Red Robin because driving to Kent and the Tukwila location is no fun when you could be spending that drive time eating bottomless steak fries and drinking freckled lemonade till your bladder explodes. This Red Robin is on the end of the Landing by LA Fitness. It's fairly new so it's clean and the tables/booths are in good condition. The service has been just as good as the other RR I've been to. So what are you waiting for? Go and get your burger and fries already! BTW: Dip your fries with the honey mustard poppy seed dressing, it's delicious!

Took 15 min to be seated on a Tuesday night ? No host around , finally manager acknowledged us ... Got seated and then he walked away and didn't see a server for another 10 min ... May I add I have a 4 year old whining and a 9 month old who's also hungry ... Food was ok . Fries cold . Strawberry lemonade was not sweet like it tends to be ... Not interested in coming back

It's a Red Robin... But hey! It's a good one! My boyfriend and I recently moved down to Renton and have stopped by this location a hand full of times. The service is always prompt, food good and decent drinks. When our server was telling us about a new drink they had started offering, he told us we'd love it... Still skeptical, he offered to to buy it for us if we didn't. The cocktail was great! All in all, fantastic service (even the bussers are happy), clean space, good food and good drinks brings this Red Robin to a 5 star.

Red Robin At Its Best! Today my husband and I went to the Red Robin at The Landing in Renton and from the outside the restaurant seems small but step inside and it rocks!  You'll see a lot of happy people and families and most of all a great experience.  Our server Kevin and Joe the Manager do such a great job, we'll definitely be back!  Hope you'll check them out soon!

I have always had good experiences at this location. If you are every unhappy with a server, the manager Tim will take care of the situation for you promptly. We went there again with my 3 year old yesterday. Our server was excellent.  Our fries and napkin got refilled without asking. This is the best Red Robin location and we will continue to take our little one here.

This red robin can get really busy, but the service in the bar is great. Megan is our regular waitress in the "lounge" area and she is very attentive.  The floor is greasy though... no running or walking fast in fear of slipping.

Very friendly staff and great burgers, Red Robin in one of my favorites. Branched out and tried the soup and salad last night (potential sacrilege!) and also enjoyed them. Our family will be making this a regular stop since it's in the neighborhood.

We all know what Red Robin food tastes like, so I won't go into much detail there. They have good burgers and pretty good food all around depending on what you are looking for.  I will say that each time I have been there, the customer service has been great! Some restaurants in the landing have good service, but I have had many occasions going out to eat in the landing where the service was less than good.  None of those incidents have occurred at Red Robin. The staff is always friendly and upbeat and the service is always quick and efficient. Thanks for all the great customer service! It makes going out to eat a lot more fun!

Decided to stop by Red Robin for a quick bite on a Saturday afternoon and ended up having one of the most horrific dining experiences ever. The server was extremely busy so we ended up getting served by at least 3 different people (seems Seahawk practice just got out). One of the waitresses was wearing such strong perfume, I had a sneeze fit (always fun when people are trying to eat) and I knew whenever she was within 50ft of our table. I ordered the cod fish sandwich and my mom ordered one of the "gourmet" burgers. She ordered her burger medium rare and Im not even sure why they asked as it came medium well. The patty was mushy with some unappetizing sautéed/carmalized union ontop a bun with an onion ring ontop amd a steak knife stuck through the entire burger. The steak knife happened to be the only utensil we received and later had to ask for napkins. My mom said it was one of the worst burgers she had ever had. My cod sandwich was tasteless, gooey and they skimped on the tarter sauce. I couldnt even taste it. We never got our "bottomless fries" that the menu had talked about. The cod sandwich ened up in my composre and the burger went to my dogs. They seemed to love it. Wont be back to this particular Red Robin.
Get there early on weekend nights. Always a great place for my burger cravings and those bottomless fries you can't beat

We went with our two young kids, aged 2 and 4 on memorial day weekend. I hadn't been in quite some time. It's a typical chain,  nothing special. For the price I expected a lot more. My sweet potato fries were cold and my whiskey ban burger came without sauce. Our appetizer had barely been put on the table when our entrees were served. Not worth it at all. We won't go back.

We went here today, for lunch, and it was WONDERFUL!  We sat in the bar area and had immediate service, despite the fact that the place was PACKED!!!   After ordering our appetizer and drinks, I headed off to use the restroom.  That is the reason this particular visit loses a star.  That ladies room was DISGUSTING!   That said.... our fried zucchini was delivered really quick, and OMG, it was awesome!  It brought back memories of my childhood when my aunt would make homemade fried zucchini.   We both ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap and a little cup of soup.  I had their French Onion, which had GREAT cheese on top.  The soup itself was lacking a little flavor.  Still, the cheese on top made up for that.  The wrap was excellent.  The BBQ sauce has a real smokey taste, which I have a particular fondness for.  And the slices of cantaloupe were really fresh.   Our waitress, Christie, was also the bartender.  And even though she was busy, she kept my Arnold Palmer refills coming without a wait.

Who doesn't like a good burger? The issue is it doesn't matter how many steak houses, family restaurants and fast food stands pop, no one consistently out performs The Dirty Bird. I love a good burger and R2 is tough to beat for price, service and value. Hot crispy bottomless fries and hickory smoked bacon. I went through a spell where I was not a fan. I soon found out it wasn't because it was a bad product, but because I was overexposed due to the fact that it was my 1st choice when it came to burgers. Try my favorite, "The Honolulu Heifer. It's the Bonzai Burger without teriyaki sauce and spike with a extra helping of bacon.  These smaller restaurants are hard to get used to, but beats the old days that you had to ride 15 to 20 minutes just to relax at a Robin.

Always loved RR. Awesome neighborhood restaurant chain. Always have a good time here. Most the time good service. Never fail me with the delicious food. I always get my Chicken brucshetta burger W/ Garlic fries (Now you gotta ask for garlic fries before you didn't need to). W/ Honey mustard. & Lots of refilling of my bottomless fries! Always a happy camper when I'm here...
Your normal every day burger join. You can't tell if you are in a Applebees, Chilies, or TGI Fridays.

Oh, Red Robin. I want to like you. I really do.  The thing is, you keep letting me down.  You see, the thing is that we have food allergies and a kid.  I'm aware that's hard - I'm cool with a lot of questions, a little bit of a longer wait and that lovely $1 surcharge you tack on to each item for an "allergy alert."  Well, that is I would be if you would actually pay attention to the order.  The first step is getting the allergy menu - which they never seem to have handy and changes every month. If you get one, keep it if you are likely to come back - it's a print-out and they throw them away after each diner. Good news: they have gluten-free soy-free dairy-free buns from Udi's. Bad news: They frequently forget and send the burger on a regular bun and then slide it over to the gluten-free bun when you point it out (food allergies don't work this way, folks.)  Or they burn the bun. Or they accidentally put those shoestring onions (batter-dipped and deep-fried) on it.   No problem, you say, I'll just go the standard gluten-free route and order a salad - no croutons.  Good luck getting them to leave the Red Robin seasoning (gluten and soy contained within) off of it, especially if you don't order a dressing. Watch croutons be picked off of the salad, crumbs still visible. Additional hiccups we've had:  a waitress pressuring my two year old to finish his plate, "you wouldn't want to upset Mommy, right?" Hey, lady, food police your own kids - mine eats pretty well and I never, ever pressure him to finish anything. Plus, he's _two_ - I don't think he's capable of clearing his meal at Red Robin. We can box it up and take it home if it is that important to you.  waitstaff disappearing for 30 minutes at a time during that post-lunchtime-lull. Ever try waiting at a table for a check with a two year old who was done eating twenty-five minutes ago? the diet-soda switchout. I can't drink diet soda. Yuck it up all you'd like about how the fat lady is allergic to diet soda, but I'd prefer to make it home without a seizure. Once I asked "is this diet? It tastes off." to be reassured it was not, then had a reaction anyway; the second time I didn't fully notice until I was mid-reaction. Thankfully, both times I was not driving the car. I now order unsweetened iced tea. This location is a bit noisier than other locations I've been to - which is saying something. Come prepared to sign or shout or jot notes or something. Why do I keep coming back?  Well, food allergies are tough to deal with. Most places that can even handle food allergies aren't kid friendly - think "bistro." So, this is our *one* available, reasonably priced place for a kid-friendly, kid-approved dinner or lunch out.  We'll be back again, I'm sure; forever with the hope that they'll finally notice on the line when it says "ALLERGY ALERT."

Place is barely half full today. Yet it took over 10min for the waitress to even acknowledge we were there (2 of us). And she still passed us by and said she'll be with us in a min. Even when it's packed not more then 2-3 min pass until our order is taken.  She seemed more pre occupied with chatting up the larger parties then checking her section, she passed us 4 times and getting other parties things so I know she saw us. Other sections had sat people after us (3-6 person group) and had already taken their orders. Won't be coming back.

We usually like the Red Robin at the Landing, but last Friday night we had a very poor experience. Even though the restaurant was half empty (which maybe should have been a sign), service was very slooow. Our waitress was very nice, but we just didn't see much of her, so we had to get some items ourselves or ask different waitress at times. Maybe they were short staffed? But it took way too long to order, and then way too long to get our items given the place was half empty, and then a long time to pay also. I also asked for a gluten-free bun for my chicken burger, but it was as hard as a rock. I think I could have used it to hammer in nails if needed, and the sweet potato fries were very soggy. Very odd quality and experience. Maybe it was just a bad night and they were short of staff, but we might consider other dinner options before going back anytime soon.

Here for a 12yr old birthday celebration so the noisy background blended perfect with the giggly crew at my table. I had the pig out tavern double and it made me say ummmmm!!! It had lots of bacon and a bacon crumbles sauce. Juicy, tasty, and flavorful. Three of the girls had never ordered off the adult menu. They were a bit wide eyed ... Don't think they will be going back to the kiddy menu ... Sorry moms and dads!

Came here to get my yearly free burger!! I got my usual Banzai and it tasted great. Tasty and juicy which is why I always choose it. The only downside here is the slow service. We had a waiter that was taking orders, but he was also the bartender. Lol.  It took awhile for us to get his attention to get us a take out box and get our bill. P.S. They have a good HH menu and will have to give that a try next time I come back.

I've been to many different Red Robin restaurant  in the past and for the most part I enjoy them. My experience at this one was the best I have ever had at a Red Robin. We were seated immediately. It is also the only time I have been at Red Robin where I have not had to ask for more fries they were brought before we ran out, which was super nice. Food also came out really fast and  was exactly what we ordered. Now Red Robin is not a super high end restaurant but the experience we had was exactly what we were looking for.

I'd give 5 stars for our waitress but I'd give the rude manager zero stars and a big thumbs down who brought our food that was not correctly made and was an A hole when we told him and didn't care. Won't visit this red robin again. Sent my food back and they just brought it back after a horrible attempt of trying to remove what was incorrect about. Gross!

My food has always been great, but I have two complaints, one minor and another major. The minor complaint is that service tends to be slow. The major complaint is that Shari, the server I've had for the past two visits has been shockingly rude. The first time, she complained about bringing me a second refill of fries (I had "bottomless" fries with my entree), then complained about the third refill. She became so annoyed that I hesitated from ordering a fourth refill. (By contrast, I usually make it through a seventh or eighth refill of fries--with no complaint.) She also chastised my friends when they ordered a second refill. On my most recent visit, I asked for the BBQ Chicken Wrap without the chicken. (I'm a vegetarian.) She let out a frustrated laugh and then, when she brought me my food, said, "Here's your SALAD WRAP," and then let out a mocking laugh. I was visibly embarrassed. I'm queer, and I'm frequently subjected to mockery when I order meatless dishes because "real men eat meat." She's very unkind and discriminatory and I am shocked that she remains employed.

One thing I like about Red Robin is that they are consistent on the quality of their food.   The Fries are always hot and the burger always cooked just right, and the service great.     But, now lets talk about this one.    Our family came here on a Monday night around 4pm.   The  host put us at a booth, then quickly changed his mind and said he wanted to move us to a table.  He got upset that I ask to stay at the booth.  But, said ok, after walking away and then coming back after asking someone something.     Our waitress was nice, but not friendly.  She took our orders, and after a long wait brought us Fries that looked old, and was cold.  They looked so sad I took a picture of them.  After another long wait our food showed up.  I'm sad to say my Gourmet BBQ Chicken Burger was cold, and the fries still looking on the don't eat me side.  They loaded us up on to many side dressings.  We line the edge of the table with them and took a picture.   Our waitress never did bring us silverware or napkins,  I had to get up and go to the men's room to get us napkins.  (gross I know, but it was better than having food all over us) Our waitress dropped off the bill and it took almost 15 minutes for her to return to get the check.   As, we were leaving she ask if we would like refills on our ice teas to go.   No, but it would have been nice to have one during the dinner. But, thanks for asking.

I'm going to give them three stars for contacting me and trying to make things right.  Mind you, they didn't bother when I was at the restaurant, only when they saw the bad review. SO, I'm not thrilled with the place or the management, but at least there is way to get some response.  I do have to reiterate,that our waitress was excellent, and I had no complaints with her whatsoever.  So, I might go back, but I won't go out of my way for this location.

I love the pretzel bites. I can eat them as an appetizer and dessert! This location is busier than somw but the service is great, very prompt and efficient. Did I mention the salted carmel shake  and bottomless (all you can eat) fries? Thumbs-up

This Red Robin is nestled in the very confusing Renton Landing shopping center. The parking lot is shared with a few other nearby shops.  The inside and outside has always been clean every time I've visited here. It's a typical Red Robin and is hit or miss on how busy it is. Normal lunch and dinner times, they're packed but if you visit at non-peak hours, then you can be sat relatively quickly.  The staff is really friendly but the last time I was there, the waiter seemed to be super busy, so our service was slow.  The food is normal Red Robin food.  In all, it's a decent place to eat if you're in the area and you're looking for an alright place to get food.

Possibly the worst food Ive ever been served in a restaurant. California Chicken Burger -slop on a bun -bacon was this microwaved type, fries looked reheated but were cold, the chicken was like rubber, the guacamole inferior and the buns were stale and dull. When we complained, the manager was too cowardky to come out and sent the server out to apologize -not her fault.  We didnt want his measly 25% credit -just a mature dialogue on how much Red Robin had gone done since our last visit some time back. Say good bye to two customers who eat out regularly, have a big family of kids who will be told not to go there either.

Okay. So I usually can stand Res Robins pre packaged nasty food. But this is the last straw. This location has made me loathe all red robins in my future. The service was so slow that not only was it aggravating but we ended up maybe staying an hour longer than we had planned because the server would never come back periodically. My spoon that I was eating my soup with had left over fucking chocolate on it from someone's dessert. How disgusting, what if that person before me had a mouth std or something. I swear it wasn't even washed. It was just dirty. I felt dirty and gross there and I still do after leaving. The place was fucking freezing as well. ITS WINTER PEOPLE!!!!! WiNTER!! I usually can stand being pretty cold but it was cold to the point where I just wanted to leave. DO NOT RECOMMEND. Stay away.

Oh, Red Robin. I came here on a Sunday evening for dinner.  My boyfriend and I chose to sit in the bar for dinner instead of waiting for a table.  We got a comfy booth (instead of those awkward pub tables).   Our server was horrible.  We saw her once to take our order then never again.  We had runners deliver our drinks and food.  Our server never bothered to check in on us.   I ordered the vegetarian Garden Burger with a Boca vegan patty.  The patty was very thick and caused the burger to be difficult to eat.  I was wondering why my burger wasn't wrapped because it was very messy to eat.  I desperately wanted a fork to eat it with but we couldn't track down our server.  In contrast, I saw other servers in different sections of the bar checking in on their tables.   Also, they serve the fries in appetizer cones now.  I pretty much got about 8 fries and I wanted a refill.  Once again, our server was nowhere to be found.  That made ordering a refill of fries impossible.  I definitely didn't feel that I got a good value for my money, and we had terrible service.

It's so sad to give RR 3 stars. I've been eating here for years and the food has always been pretty consistent, always hitting the spot. However, on my recent trips to this location, I've been less than satisfied.  I'm not sure what it is, but this rebrand doesn't seem like it's going well... They've changed the menu, added a few items, which is okay. The red baskets are now only for kids and the burgers are served on a plate with the fries in a little bottomless container (cute, huh?), but they only put like 5 fries in it and you immediately have to ask for more. The most disappointing part of yesterday's experience my burger, it tasted and looked like a frozen patty. I really hope this is not a permanent change...  My other half had the whiskey river BBQ chicken burger and said it was as good as ever. The service was very attentive and helpful, my freckled lemonade was never empty!  This location gets quite busy with lots of families and kids, so remember that if that's not the atmosphere you're looking for.

The food is always great and prices low. What I was really impressed with was last time I was in, I asked for no relish on my burger. The burger still ended up with relish on it. I told my server and he offered to make a new burger, but I told him it was fine and just wanted a new bun. The manager came out and brought a new bun and asked if I was sure I didn't want a new burger. Talk about amazing customer service! I was very impressed and will come back just for service like that!
Sometimes you don't want to explore and experiment. well this is the place. It's good just not great.
Aww I got a trainee server. How cute. Jk good job even though you forgot our pickles and spilt water in my fries.

This is my favorite Red Robin. The staff is always polite and attentive. They tend to get super busy around lunch and dinner time AND the building is really small, so it can feel really tight at those times. Even though it gets so busy, the staff keeps it cool. I have never had any issues *knock on wood* here. My order is always top notch. If I ever have an issue they fix it right away. Ryder is one of my favorite waitresses, but I have no complaints about anyone else. Keep up the good work. Also, I really appreciate all of the gluten free and vegetarian options. Thank you.

It's always something with this RR.  In a hurry? Not normally, but this time, at this RR, you're going to wait a lot longer than normal. Trying to make that movie time? Not tonight, you better look elsewhere for the rest of your evening plans.  Looking for the correct order? Have a coupon? F$&% you, you ordered the wrong item to qualify. Went last night....   Our server Christina was awesome.. the people who were helping her?  Rude and Obnoxious.. specifically Will, he brought the food, set it down, asked if we needed anything and my partner asked for marinara for the cheese stix.. (duh?) .. he looked at my partner like he just asked him to murder the person next to him. We never got the marinera from him, but did from our server.. later he walks by our table with a half rack of food.. saying 'get out of my way, get out of my way'. Higher quality burgers and usually good service.  The cool thing I found recently is their new bottomless rewards program called Red Royalty.  When you visit Red Robin, be sure to get a Red Royalty card and register it at  .  Just for registering it you get a FREE appetizer and you get a FREE burger on your birthday month.  After a 5th visit, you get $20 off your 6th visit then on your 10th visit you get a burger, salad, sandwich or an entree FREE.  In addition you get surprise offers and rewards.   Can't beat that deal!

We generally love Red Robin and have never really had a bad experience or sub par food at one.  That is until we visited the Red Robin at the Landing in Renton WA.  First, the wait staff was more interested in chatting and socializing in the galley/kitchen area than serving.  It took easily over 30 minutes to get our dinner even though the restaurant was only at about half capacity.  When the food came, it was awful.  My club sandwich was not toasted and completely soggy from the vast quantity of mayonnaise on it.  When I tried my Freckled Fruit I realized there wasn't really any fruit in it, just mush.  Also, the fork I was using had a severe taste of garlic which I'm sure is because it wasn't cleaned.  If this wasn't bad enough, both my wife and I had severe stomach issues the next morning.  I will certainly NEVER RETURN to this location.  And why would you when you could go to a better managed location only 10-15 minutes away and have a better overall experience without the disgust and illness.

Gotta give prop's for a few reasons: 1) All Red Robin restaurants have the same menus...and the food tastes the same across the board.  Gotta give kudos for consistency 2) Kid-friendly.  I love that my son loves to go here and can get a good tasting meal when we can as well 3) Refills - my soda never was lower than 2/3rds empty when I was being hit up for a refill 4) Really Friendly The "ehhs": 1) Can I get some elbow room...PLEASE?  Good Lord I think they created the smallest Red Robin on the planet!  I don't know...maybe that shoudl be a kudos (feat of amazement)? Not much to say.

I like Red Robins I like their Santa Fe Burger I like how they give me bottomless fries I like how they give me bottomless strawberry lemonade I like how they sang happy birthday to me yesterday and gave me a free sunday. Thanks Red Robins for celebrating my birthday with me.
Offer lot's of healthy alternatives and are really good about adjusting menu items to fit your dietary needs!
sad. there are NO bussers and the poor server was so stretched thin he could not properly wait on us. The manager here should be fired for being so damn incompetent.

I've been here on several different occasions and it's pretty predictable. Service is always good, food is the same. My biggest complaint is that there aren't more vegetarian options. Pretty much it's just the garden burger or quesadilla from the appetizer menu. Why do all the salads have meat? Why are all the wraps meaty? I like the garden burger just fine but quite frankly, I'm just bored with it.

This was honestly the worst Red Robin experience we had ever experienced and the restaurant was not even busy. When we arrived, the hostess had her back turned to the door and was leaning over the podium like she was bored. When she finally acknowledged us, she blandly asked how many in our party and never showed a hint of a smile or greeting. After waiting a few minutes, I took my daughter to the bathroom and left my boyfriend to grab our table when ready. Upon our return to the front, I discovered that two groups of people who came in after us were seated by a different host who came up  and ignored that our party was there (while the other hostess was still there and did not intervene), this young man was also bland and didn't seem to care about his patrons either. I suggested we go somewhere else at this point, but we decided to just stay since it couldn't be TOO much longer. After about a twenty minute wait, while at least four booths and three tables had been open the entire time, we were finally seated, and when we asked for a booth instead of a table arrangement, the hostess acted as though we were a huge nuisance, and reluctantly with a huff and  puff seated us in an OPEN booth in an area that was already being served, 'so not in a sectioned off for the next rush area'. The server was thankfully friendly and smiley, though lacked attentiveness, we ordered, and ended up waiting another 30 mins for two salads and a child's mac and cheese. To make matters worse, the child's mac and chesse and fries were cold. We asked a bus boy nearby for some assistance, and he looked like he was frightened we even spoke to him. To be clear, we are very patient respectful people.  The bus boy got the manager, who thanked us for letting him know about the child's meal as this had happened already FOUR times that same day... the manager actually admitted that to us. I don't normally feel a need to give negative reviews, but this experience was just terrible. I truly hope they can get their staff on board with the way every other Red Robin operates and soon. Had this been my first experience with this chain, I would never set foot in another.

I've been a RR fan for like 20 years (I'm totally dating myself!) Its a RR.  Great burgers, big beers, friendly service, and TVs for football.  I'm happy to have one down the street from me.     I would have given it 5 stars if they didn't over cook my wings.  I'll be back though, I always have.  Especially if the big bird with the pantyhose stays away.
Been going to Red Robins and have never had a bad experience both in service and food. I always get the Whiskey River BBQ burger with bottomless fries.

Horrible experience at this red robins.. Came in they sat us right away when they finished cleaning the booth. Not realizing that is was still wet, sat in the moist booth chairs.. Ordered food then got our appetizer onion rings towers.. Ask waiter for ketchup because the one we had was empty upon arriving, he didn't get it for us until we received our burgers appox 5+ mins later.. Tipped them to the nearest dollar as he shouldn't have deserved a penny.. Never coming back to then carnival..

Okay for burgers except last time I went there our burgers were served with green tomatoes. Biting into the burger was awful.  Told the waitress and she took my plate and replaced the tomatoes and returned my already bitten burger. Thought she would replace the burger but guess not.
Had the mushroom burger and was surprised to find out it was nothing inside of it except for cheese, meat and mushrooms, Yuck! ending up throwing it away. The fries were also nasty.

I like this Red Robin, it is sooooooooooooooooooo much better than southcenter's one. At one point I wrote the entire company off because of too many bad experiences, but this location here has me going back at least once a month. I adore their soup and salad combo. For $10 I can get a good portion of soup and any salad I want, which is quite filling I might add. The salad is fresh tasting and my chicken is nice and crispy, warm, flavorful. I also like the burgers, I ask for well done and I'm super happy I actually get well done. FYI, you can always ask for your fries to come out first if you are super hungry. Oh and the service is always nice here, and quick moving.
Jamaican shake tastes like milk, margarita got no tequila, & the server was trippin!!!

Aww, man.  I wanted to be the first to review this new establishment!  Note: the Yelp map shows this establishment in a wrong location.   We went for Mom's Day dinner tonight (the kids, 3 and 5, told their mom this is where they wanted to take her out). Food was awesome and the new place looks terrific (but possibly the smallest RR I can remember -- big bar area but seems to be smallish dining area than most RRs).  The new location is one of the first places to open in this phase of the Landing shopping center in North Renton.   The service was so-so, hence the lower rating.  I don't believe it was the server's fault specifically, likely a combination of factors that I'd sum up as it being new and still working through kinks.  Here what was wrong tonight: a long wait for food to arrive (a good thing though, without prompting, they did bring us a basket of fries as an "appetizer" while we waited), drink refills took a really long time -- and when they did come, one beverage was incorrect and the other had no syrup, it was just seltzer, and lastly, the fries with one of our meals was supposed to be garlic fries but they arrived as plain fries and the server never brought a "new" dish of garlic fries despite they'd said they'd take care of it.      Granted, none of those were deal killers for us, but given prior pretty good experiences at RRs (Tukwila in the last year has been outstanding) we had high expectations going in. Positives that'd keep us going back: ample free parking (a huge parking structure is going up right next to RR plus they have a large lot behind the restaurant), a reasonable offering on the kids menu, and generally affordable prices.   If you're a bus rider, the Metro 240 and Sound Transit 560, 564, and 565 have a stop east of here and a block down (kind of a long walk) with fairly frequent service between North Renton and the Downtown Renton Transit Center.

Drinks took half an hour to get to our table, food took another half hour and was cold when it arrived. Manager had come and delivered our food. Not sure if they have new staff or what but definitely going to be awhile before I come back again.

I used to moderately enjoy this place. That was until last night, I was so appalled by my experience last night, my friend and her entire family (21 of us total) decided we would not return to the Landing Red Robing again. It's really sad when a place feels they are the only place on the block, and so can treat people like cattle. So many great places have gone in down at the Landing, my friend and I have decided we will never return. Our servers name was Nicole, a red headed girl that clearly hated her job. She ignored our end of the table the entire meal, and only came down after I stacked 8 or 9 pieces of dirty dishes and glasses. Granted here is where most people would lose their cool, but accidents happened. Instead of apologizing or showing any sort of remorse, she bolted, even though everyone at my table reacted to the spill. At this point I was a little hacked off. I spoke with the Bartender to close out my tab I had opened with him. At no time during the rest of the meal did the Manager (KYLE) bother to stop by and check in with myself or our table.  This Red Robin shows they don't care about their guests, especially if your party is large enough for them to tack on automatic gratuity. If there was a "zero star" on this rating system it is what I would use. Most places would terminate people on the spot for how the server and manager acted, guess we can't expect better from Red Robin

Went for dinner last night. 3 gals at the reception, decided to sit in the bar. After waiting for about 7 min and no one showed up we went back out and asked for restaurant seating. Waited another 5 min or so before someone showed up. It felt like we were on a version of  "restaurant impossible" waiters and waitresses were standing around talking everywhere except with the customers. When our waiter finally came we mentioned it and his comment was "we have been so slow today we have been passing the time chatting, guess we havent gotten into the work routine yet" Really? I guess I should have been more understanding! Good Bye Red Robin!!

Red Robin, Red Robin, send Red right Robin. Get it? (I don't care if you do).  I really hate to reveal this legacy, as I am one of the few who probably ever order this sunken treasure. And this sunken treasure I speak of; one may question what it is. One may have questions, questions such as: What is this sunken treasure at Red Robin?  Why is there sunken treasure at Red Robin?  I don't notice any fish tanks in Red Robin, so how could there be sunken treasure?  Well, for all of you fellow question asking feathered bird lovers, I have a confession. These words I write are a metaphor. A metaphor : "the glorious sunken treasure at Red Robin". Can you guess what it is? What it means? Hint: it sank because it was covered with too much buzzard wing sauce, pepperjack cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and chipotle mayo. And the fries didn't sink. Yes, hmmm. Yes.  It is the Rajin Cajin' Burger! And they still make it if you know the correct password. Okay there is no password. But ask them and they will make it. This burger is EXCELLENTE! Go for the treasure, stay for the Rajin Cajin'.

This place is TERRIBLE.  It all started with the floor, it was super slippery from being covered in grease.  You could tell that it had been weeks since anyone had bothered mopping the place.              Moving on, We were seated at a table that was completely broken,  just resting my hand on the table was enough to cause it to nearly topple over. How did they expect me to eat off of this?  After informing our waitress that this would not do, we moved to a booth.            After moving to the booth we were now being ignored by our waitress, presumably because we were no longer seated in her section.  We ended up having to wait another 15 minutes for another waitress to notice we were there, and this was on a rather slow night.  Whatever, we order our food and drinks.            10 minutes later our waitress returns to inform us that they do not have any regular white bread hamburger buns for the burger my date ordered.  A hamburger joint without hamburger buns, are you serious?  They do apparently have some other buns they can use though, so my date agrees to whatever their substitution is.              Our dinner comes out a short while later,  and a server drops off our food minus the silverware I need.  What do they expect me to do, go caveman style on it?  No problem just asked the next employee that passed by for some silverware.  Should I really need to ask for silverware?       Now for the food itself.  The chicken I ordered was cold, maybe room temperature at best.  What do they do, pull it out of a freezer and stick it in a microwave for 30 seconds?  It sure tasted like it.   Same story on the Burger my date ordered, she said it tasted like it was sitting out all night.       After eating what little of our food we could stomach our waitress promptly brought us our check and took our plates. The waitress must have known how bad the food was to not even bother asking if we wanted to take our left overs home.  She didn't even bother asking us if we wanted desert  or perhaps more drinks?   Which we did as we were still hungry from the less than appetizing dinner.  She came back after she saw we were looking at the drink menu and we ordered a desert that long story short was just as disappointing as the rest of the meal.               To top everything off on the way out my date slipped and fell on their greasy slippery floor.

OK, I will admit it.  I like Red Robin.  Yeah, I know it is a chain and they all make the same stuff without much orginality.  But I like burgers and their burgers are pretty good.  I even kind of like their fries.  Yeah, I know they are frozen food but sometimes I just get a craving for this and I am happy that it is within walking distance of the 737 factory.         My boss took our group out to dinner today and the service was great as usual and I had a really good Pub burger.  We often go in with 8 or more people and they have no problems treating us right and even offering separate checks if we need it.  So nothing exciting at Red Robin, but I always know that I will get a good burger with good service.  I will keep coming back.

Don't order food to go you will be disappointed. Something will be left out, fries for your burger, dressing and bread for your salad.Din in at least this way you know what your lunch/dinner will look like and you can ask for something if needed.

Omg! The service was outstanding! We had Jordan K as our waitress. She was amazing and we will definitely come back. The restaurant itself was clean, we got our food quickly, and it was so good! I highly recommend this Red Robin.

Red Robin definitely knows their burgers. Food is always good, but the service in the bar at this location is really slow. I have been there twice, and both times had to wait, especially when it comes to getting the bill. I will give them props though for having a gluten-free menu for my friend.
Drinks are always good. Tropical Mai Tai. Food was not nice and hot at all. Wait staff good though.

I like coming to Red robbins. The service is always great as expected. No matter what Red Robbins I go to, the service is fast and friendly.  I'm a little disappointed they took off the lettuce wrap burger on the menu though. I loved it since I don't like bread. It was delicious. If only they can hear my plee. Give it back O.O I probably won't be back till the lettuce wrap is too. *sigh..*

heart attack waiting to happen...but this place is pretty solid, and great for a family affair with the kiddos.  they'll serve you fries upfront if you ask too so you can munch on them while you wait for your food.  their burgers are all pretty good, but my hands down fav is the royal red robin burger.  their chicken burgers aren't bad either. make sure you go when it's someone's birthday so you can embarrass them with a vigorous round of singing, clapping, and free dessert.  can't complain with that right? :)

If I could give ZERO STARS I would.  This place is shitty if you are looking for a to-go order. In the past 2 months we have eaten at red robins probably 4-5 times, and only once was it at this one! We ALWAYS call this red robin first because we live 3 minutes away , but they never ever pick up the phone! We make the trip to the southcenter one and have never been disappointed. We ordered from the landing tonight (hey! someone knows how to answer a phone!) and  the person who took the order was absolutely rude and snippy.  They told us 10 minutes for the order, and we arrived 10 minutes later, and my husband went in to pick up the order and ended up sitting at the bar for 5-6 minutes before ANYONE even asked if he could be helped-- and that was with him trying to get the bartender's attention!! When the short tempered older woman at the bar ended up helping him, she was not personable at all. In our order we'd asked for extra fries and honey mustard with both orders (usually they put the extra fries in a separate box).... one burger had the normal amount of fries for an order, the other had like 8.... and we only had one honey mustard!  This location is horrific, short staffed, rude, and clearly not paying attention to detail on a simple order. i'll make the drive to southcenter from now on!
Our usual burger joint for Jase and me. WE LOVE RR!!
This location is busy but the service is very slow. Food is good. I don't think they are fully staffed at night for dinner.
Just took my Family in for a dinner treat tonight and... The waitress we got was outstanding! She was so on it! Our food was out quickly, drinks filled. She was attentive. Yep... we left super happy.

Lack of servers made our family with young children wait for a long time when only 40% of the restaurant was empty on a wednesday evening at 5.30 pm dinner time. Eventually the food was rushed, and lacking flavor

Had dinner with my daughter Before we went over to See a movie. I had a beer with dinner,One beer. My daughter is 16 years old, And  she's seen me drink a beer before. And I'm a Democrat.       Needless to say those last few Moments ruined the whole experience.

The worst red robin experience we have ever had. Certainly not up to Red Robin standards. We were seated after more than 10 other groups who came in after us were seated. Add in that there was a very disruptive family with 3 girls who were yelling and screaming, standing up on the seats, and putting their feet on the table they were at and the manager did nothing even after we let him know about it. The floors were slick and disgusting from food. The fries were cold when we got our food. Our middle girl asked for more Mac & cheese since it is a free refill item and she loves the stuff. And to top it off, the waiter was obviously stressed and accidentally dropped food and a thing of ranch on my fiance when he came to buss our table.
